revision.text:
Josef Eduard Scheungraber is a German national notable for having been convicted of the murder of 10 Italian civilians in the Italian town of Falzano di Cortona in 1944. [http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/08/11/germany.nazi.crimes/index.html ''CNN report'']
Born in 1919, he was 25 at the time of the murders, and 90 at the time of his conviction by a German court (he had been convicted in absentia by an Italian court in 2006).
He served in the German army during World War Two and it was during that conflict that he ordered the capture and summary execution of ten civilians as a resprisal for the killing of two german soldiers under his command.
It was speculated at the time of his conviction that his may be last conviction for Nazi-era crimes.

MasterSeries is the Strucural Analysis Drafting and Detailing Software, produced by Civil and Structural Computer Services. ==About MasterSeries Company== MasterSeries is the UK's leading range of integrated structural analysis, design, drafting and detailing software with over 10,000 users worldwide. Its power, versatility, user friendliness and excellent technical support make it the designers first choice. Over the past three decades Civil and Structural Computer Services Limited has played a leading role in the development of integrated structural analysis, design, drafting and detailing software. In 1986, we were the first company to exhibit integrated analysis and design software to BS 5950. The company policy of producing high quality engineering software backed by excellent technical support and continuous product development has resulted in an ever-expanding national and international customer base. Major updates are sent regularly to all our users as part of the software maintenance agreement. MasterSeries for Windows conforms to a number of national and international Codes of Practice. MasterSeries is widely used by Consulting Engineers, Councils, Steelwork Fabricators and Industrial and Educational organisations worldwide. MasterSeries is modular; each module can be used independently or combined with others to form an integrated suite. This allows you to create a tailored structural design suite to meet your specific needs. The company dedication to customer service and support has led to unwavering user commitment, borne out over the years by their commendation of the MasterSeries. Indeed, we are proud that many users have, of their own volition, demonstrated the MasterSeries to other engineering companies. Customer loyalty has also been proven by users who have changed jobs and subsequently converted their new employer to MasterSeries as well as those users who have started their own firms and chosen MasterSeries as an invaluable asset in the development of their business. ==General Features== MasterSeries provides a complete solution for the structural office, from analysis to design, drafting and detailing in steel, concrete, composite, masonry, timber and retaining walls. All MasterSeries programs have been developed in-house, by one team of structural engineers, ensuring a substantially higher degree of integration than any other structural engineering software available on the market today. MasterSeries will help you produce complete design reports with consistent style and high quality presentation of which you can be proud. You will also benefit from the expert technical support offered directly by our team of development engineers.

'''Modular''' MasterSeries is modular; each part can be used to full advantage, as a stand-alone program or combined with other modules to form an integrated suite, thus saving time, reducing errors, increasing productivity and saving you time and money.
'''Engineer Friendly''' MasterSeries is Engineer Friendly, putting you in control, and ensures that you can make your own engineering decisions - "You are the Master". MasterSeries presents you clearly with all the facts surrounding your design objective, enabling you to concentrate on real engineering.
'''Powerful with a Short Learning Curve''' MasterSeries is versatile, reliable and fast, with powerful editing facilities and excellent output. Its user friendliness and the high quality of technical support ensure that you can put the software to practical use immediately. The software is easy to learn even for occasional users.
'''Technical Support''' The development team is directly involved in technical support. That's why our users consider the quality of our technical support to be second to none. File zipping and un-zipping utilities are available for fast e-mailing of data thus providing the user with a speedy and effective resolution to the most difficult problems.
'''We Listen''' MasterSeries has been developed by structural engineers. That's why we understand your needs and respond immediately to your requirements and suggestions. This forms the basis of our dynamic product development.
==Software== Please click on this link below to view the entire product range, alternatively you can view individual elements by clicking on the link beside their descriptions. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-range.aspx MasterSeries Software Range] '''Analysis''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=57451 MasterFrame: Space, Grillage and Plane Frame Analysis] MasterFrame is a state-of-the-art structural frame analysis software program, incorporating many advanced analysis features to help Engineers meet the increasingly strenuous and demanding requirements of modern design codes. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62711 MasterSeries: 3D Model Manager] MasterSeries 3D Model Manager is the productivity centre of the MasterSeries modelling environment, transforming the way you think and work in the analysis and design processes of practically any structure. Here you find the perfect balance between automation and Engineering control. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62844 MasterKey: Wind Analysis] MasterKey Wind Analysis is exactly what every engineer has been looking for to dramatically reduce the burden of wind application to BS 6399 Pt 2, making the accurate application of wind loads a very simple and virtually automated task. You will soon find that it has more than paid for itself. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62901 MasterFrame: Finite Element Analysis] MasterFrame Finite Element Analysis delivers the power of this method into the hands of the engineer without any of the inherent complexity. Using numerically superior 8 noded shell elements, building components such as shear walls, flat slabs and transfer slabs can be modeled with ease. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62920 MasterFrame: Dynamic Analysis] MasterFrame Dynamic Analysis is a state-of-the-art program, which can be used to investigate the forces and displacements resulting from dynamic loading. The program will calculate the natural frequencies and mode shapes associated with the many modes of vibration of a structure. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63718 MasterBeam: Beam Designers] MasterBeam: Beam Designers are a suite of 3 specialist programs providing analysis & design of cantilevers,simply supported and continuous beams and sub frames with up to 16 spans. '''Concrete Design''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63057 MasterKey: Concrete Design] MasterKey Concrete Beams, Columns and Pad Foundations are three programs for the design of the Concrete components in structures analysed using MasterFrame, MasterPort or MasterFrame Flat Slab Construction. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62977 MasterBeam: Concrete Beam Designer] MasterKey Concrete Beam Designer is a specialist program providing analysis, design, detailing and scheduling of cantilevers, simply supported & continuous beams and sub frames with up to 16 spans to BS 8110 and BS 4466 or BS 8666 [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62882 MasterFrame: Flat Slab] MasterFrame: Flat Slab Construction is a state-of-the-art program for the Analysis, Design and Detailing of Single and Multi-Storey Flat Slab Construction in accordance with section 3.7 of BS 8110. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62768 MasterRC: Pile Cap] MasterSeries Pile Cap Designer provides you with a fast route to the analysis, design, detailing and scheduling of regularly shaped pile caps for 1 to 9 piles. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=343749 MasterBeam: Concrete Beam Designer - Free version] Free version of MasterKey Concrete Beam Designer for the analysis and design of cantilever, simple, fixed and partially fixed single span beams to BS 8110 and EuroCode 2. '''Steel Design''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63076 MasterKey: Steel Design] MasterKey I-Sections, MasterKey Hollow Sections and MasterKey Angles, Channels and Tees are 3 interactive programs providing comprehensive design of steel sections to BS 5950 and EuroCode 3. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63114 MasterKey: Moment and Simple Connections] MasterKey Moment and Simple Connections are the two leading Structural Steel connections design programs in the UK. They have transformed connections design from a laborious and time-consuming task, to a highly efficient engineering decision-making process. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62806 MasterPort: MasterPort Plus] MasterPort Plus is a new and innovative approach to the generation, elastic-plastic analysis and design of portal frames, providing a complete management system where all aspects of a 3D portal frame building design can be considered with ease. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62787MasterPort: MasterPort Lite] MasterPortLite contains many of the fundamental elastic-plastic analysis and design components found in MasterPortPlus, enabling you to automatically generate and design a wide variety of plane portal frames. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62939 MasterBeam: Steel Beam Designer] MasterKey Steel Beam Designer provides analysis and design of cantilever, simple & continuous beams and sub frames with up to 16 spans to BS 5950. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=328101 MasterBeam: Steel Beam Designer - Free Version] Free version of MasterKey Steel Beam Designer for the analysis and design of cantilever, simple, fixed and partially fixed single span beams to BS 5950 and EuroCode 3. '''Composite Design''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62958 MasterBeam: Composite Design] MasterBeam Composite Beam Design provides a powerful and extremely user friendly program for the design of primary, secondary and mixed primary-secondary composite beams with or without web openings. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63038 MasterBeam: Composite Slim Floor] MasterBeam Composite SlimFLOOR considers a wide range of design situations where metal decking or pre-cast concrete units are supported on the bottom flange of the beam. � '''Timber''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62825 MasterBeam: Timber Design] MasterKey Timber Design and MasterBeam Timber Beam Designer represent a combined package offering exceptional power and flexibility to cover all your timber needs. '''Masonry''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63095 MasterKey: Masonry Design] MasterKey Masonry Design provides a powerful and extremely user-friendly program for the design of reinforced and unreinforced masonry walls and columns to IS 325 and BS 5628 Part 1 and Part 2. '''Retaining Walls''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62863 MasterKey: Retaining Walls] MasterKey Retaining Walls Design offers the most comprehensive program available for the design of both reinforced and unreinforced concrete and masonry retaining walls to CP2, BS 8002, BS 8110, IS 325 and BS 5628 Part1 and Part2. '''Drafting & Detailing''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62749 MasterRC: MasterRC Detailing] MasterRC is an AutoCAD (R2006+) application providing a powerful yet easy to use set of tools for the accurate detailing of reinforced concrete. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62730 MasterRC: MasterRC Scheduler] MasterRC Scheduler: The MasterRC bar scheduler is built into MasterRC, our RC detailing system for AutoCAD. It is also available as a stand alone package, enabling you to schedule directly from MasterKey Concrete Design and MasterKey Retaining Walls. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63133 MasterSeries: MasterCAD General Frames] MasterCAD General Frames is the drawing production and 3D model exchange centre of the MasterSeries, providing DXF drawings and a multitude of import and export capabilities. '''Lite Suite''' [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=63190 MasterSeries: PowerPad] MasterSeries PowerPad is a complete structural analysis and design suite and is the ideal choice for those who require a wide range of capabilities at an extremely affordable price. [http://www.masterseries.co.uk/product-specific.aspx?dataid=62692 MasterSeries: Office Tools] MasterSeries Office Tools is an add-on program enabling you to export results from all MasterSeries programs to Microsoft Office. It also enables you to create templates for standard calculations using highly efficient and very flexible in-built analysis and design functions.
----

revision.text: {{db-person}} '''How It all Started. Demarius Wallace Who Is known to some people as 4DAmbition. Started rapping at the age of 5 in a small town known as Madisonville Texas. He quit For 7 years, and then started getting back into the game of rap at the middle age of 13. He knew a person that new somebody that could get him a career at the time. But Sadly at the time 4DAmbition was just nearing the end of school and was trying to learn more about the rap game. (Currently at the time 4DAmbition didn't know anything about rap names meaning who you are, or why you call yourself that.) (He was also Focusing on sounding like Tupac Shakur, Who was known as 2Pac For being the greatest Rapper of all time) A Month Later he decided that he wanted to be more ''Original'' So he came up with the name Rebarius. Which stood for the name of monster or a stone cold beast. But He could not figure out a ''GOOD'' reason to call himself that so he came up with the name Reashaun. 2 Weeks later his cousin said that the name sounded like the name of a singer. So he thought hard about it and came up with his New name ''4DAmbition''. He's Currently wiriting songs known as '''''Major Swag Upgrade''''' '''''Swagger Inn''''' '''''Lots of recognition''''' and '''''Everybody Aint perfect'''''. Wiki Page To Be Continued. A fleet of four-wheeled "toastrack" coaches were made for the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] on the [[Isle of Man]] between 1896 and 1905. They were all supplied by G.F. Milnes & Co. of [[Birkenhead]] and were of similar design and resemblde a smaller version of the trailers used on the [[Manx Electric Railway]] nearby, and were originally either varnised or painted a dark colour (contemporary postcards make it difficult to tell which) but the restored versions are varnished and carry no lining out, which is evident from early views. [[Image:Ggr-coach.jpg|thumb|right|The line's resident re-built toastrack set with replica battery engine "Polar Bear".]]
=="A" Coaches== The original four-wheeled "toastrack" coaches supplied with "Sea Lion" in 1896 were never originally numbered but are known as the "A" coaches; there feature stone guards at rail level and a more plain valence design when compared to other coaches, though this was modified within the first year of operation as it is understood that the design was sufficiently prominent to allow passengers to bang their heads when boarding and alighting trains. Today, there is one re-built 1896-type coach on the railway, carrying the number "1" but this bears no relation to original numbering, which varied from each repaint. Two further original coaches reside at [[Amberley Chalk Pits Museum]] but these have flat roofs, whereas the resident one has a correctly curved roof.
=="B" Coach== This was ordered owing to popularity of the line in the early years. This coach was slightly different from the others, having higher windows, different style valences, and is always known by its letter owing to these small differences; it remains to be re-built but several parts are in store, distinguishable from their odd dimensions when compared with the more standard fittings of the other coaches. During the railway's centenary year in 1996 one of the [[1905]] built coaches that had been removed from the glen in 1967 and rebuilt at the [[West Lancashire Light Railway]] was returned to the line on loan, having since returned; it is to be noted that during its stay it carried a brass "B" in the bulkhead interior but this indicated "borrowed" rather than being the actual "B" coach, causing some confusion, the original having yet to be rebuilt.
=="C" & "D" Coaches== These were un-numbered originally and made up the final four coaches and arrived with Polar Bear in 1905 referred to as "C" and "D" type, the only major difference being the small style changed of valancing. There are three restored coaches of this type with "Polar Bear" at Amberley Chalk Pits but the metalwork used is a mixture of all designs, and the result is something of a hybrid. A further coach which serves as a disabled car. A further original re-built coach is at the [[West Lancashire Light Railway]] but made a return to Groudle in 1996. There are currently two re-built 1905-type coaches resident on the [[Groudle Glen]] Railway which see regular service.
==Liveries== It is understood from contemporary literature and limited photographic resources that the coaches delivered in 1896 were either varnished or painted in a dark colour. Images purporting to be from opening day show the coaches with a light coloured lining-out on the valences and end panels, but no numbering is visible. It is likely that if they were varnished this gave way to painting for appearance purposes. The resident restored coaches are all varnished. The set at [[Amberley Chalk Pits Museum]] are painted with black bulkhead panels, light brown valences, detailing and uprights, with further detailing in off-white, and grey floors. It is not known whether this is an historically accurate livery or not. By the final years of the line, the remaining servicable coaches appeared in a "fairground" livery of red and off-white (almost yellow), and evidence suggests that in the interim time they had recieved an all-over red/maroon colour scheme with white lining.
==Miscellaneous== Owing to the number of newly fabricated parts on each site, both [[Groudle Glen]] and [[Amberley]], and a number of parts still in store, when the long-term project of completing the final coaches is done, it will result in there being more "original" coaches than there ever were on the railway. A further 1896 coach is mid-way through being built, but the demise of the railway's in-house carpenter [[Harold Flavell]] in 2008 effectively ceased the project temporarily. Each of the three resident coaches on the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] now carry brass plaques in memory of Mr. Flavell, who built all of them.

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'Inheriting a title taken from the Infantas of Spain, Pedro Alcantara de Toledo y Salm Salm, XIII Duque del Infantado, was an extremely rich, powerful and popular fi...'
revision.text: Inheriting a title taken from the Infantas of Spain, Pedro Alcantara de Toledo y Salm Salm, XIII Duque del Infantado, was an extremely rich, powerful and popular figure in Spain generally and in court circles. He was ‘more educated than most of the Spanish grandees’<ref>A. Rabbe, Biographie Universelle (Paris, 1830)</ref>, having been raised and schooled in Paris. When Spain declared war on Revolutionary France in 1793, he raised an infantry regiment at his own expense. He fought with it in Catalonia against the French beside a Portuguese division and commanded a brigade of the 2nd division of the army of Estremadura. After the treaty of Amiens, he used the peace to establish cotton mills in Catalonia using technical experts from England. In the following years he became very close to Ferdinand, the heir to the Spanish throne. This led him into conflict with the weak King Charles IV and his ambitious chief minister Godoy, and he was banished from Madrid in 1805. Within two years, and unfortunately for the Duke’s quiet life, Ferdinand was arrested and amongst his papers was found a nomination for the Duke to be Commander in Chief of the Spanish forces. Tried and sentenced to death as a traitor, he was reprieved by popular sentiment and the intervention of the French Ambassador. A revolt in March 1808 resulted in the abdication of the king, the sacking of his manipulative chief minister Godoy and the ascent of Ferdinand VII to the Spanish throne, with the Duke of Infantado at his side. Taking advantage of the chaos, Napoleon ‘invited’ the factions including the Duke, to a conference in Bayonne. At this meeting a new Spanish constitution was signed by the assembled Spanish deputies that resulted in the throne passing to Joseph Bonaparte, Napoleon’s brother. The only major Spanish figure that spoke in opposition was the Duke of Infantado, who ‘had opposed to the utmost any recognition of the foreign monarch’<ref>Constant, Recollections on the Private Life of Napoleon Bonaparte (The merriam Company, 1895)</ref>. Not long afterwards the Duke called the nation to arms to resist the French, for which he was condemned as a traitor yet again, but this time by Napoleon. At the head of the Spanish army he was defeated by the French in 1809 at the battle of Ucles. His palace at Guadalajara and all his goods were confiscated by Joseph. The Duke joined forces with the British, at that time under Sir John Moore. He was extremely highly regarded by the British plenipotentiary, Mr J Hookham Frere, who was accustomed to late and inaccurate intelligence from his allies: ‘Had Sir John Moore been so fortunate as to find so candid a correspondent as the Duke of Infantado, a person who would describe things as they were, there is no doubt that the events and conclusion of the campaign would have been very different’<ref>J. Moore, A Narrative of the Campaign of the British Army in Spain (J. Johnson, London, 1809)</ref>, referring to Moore’s retreat to Corunna. Wellington later had much cordial correspondence with the Duke <ref>J. Gurwood, The Dispatches of The Duke of Wellington (London: John Murray, 1838)</ref>during the later stages of the Peninsular War. Amusingly, but quite naturally for the times, all the correspondence between these allies during the war with France was in French. In 1811 the Spanish parliament (the Cortes) nominated him as the President of the Council of Spain and sent him on a secret mission to the Prince Regent in London. He returned in 1812 and although he was proposed by Wellington as head of the 4th Army under British control, his enemies at the Spanish court decreed otherwise and he had to be content with leading his own regiment. After the end of the war with France in 1814 he retired again. He was recalled in 1823 to the Presidency of the Regency and was responsible for returning the king to the throne. Soon afterwards, tired of intrigue in the court and government, he retired to his country estates and eventually died there in 1841. A postscript to the life of this leading Spaniard is less edifying. Pedro de Alcántara, the richest man in Spain, was succeeded firstly by his nephew who died childless after three years and then in turn by another nephew Mariano Téllez-Girón and Beaufort-Spontin (1814-1882), the 15th Duke of Infantado and the 12th Duke of Osuna. He was Spanish Ambassador in London, Paris and Moscow where the Russian Court were taken aback by his spending habits, reputably including bringing all his fresh flowers from Valencia to Moscow by train, throwing away clothes after one wearing and throwing solid gold dinner services into the Neva river after a banquet. His profligacy was such that one of his titles, Osuna, has been used as a Spanish byword for waste. All of his inheritance, the greatest fortune in Spain, was frittered in 38 years and at his death his personal possessions were auctioned to go towards paying his debts.

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with '== Hotel Barges (Peniche Hôtel) == Following the decline in commercial and freight carriage on the canals of Europe many barges have been converted into floating h...'
revision.text:
== Hotel Barges (Peniche Hôtel) == Following the decline in commercial and freight carriage on the canals of Europe many barges have been converted into floating hotels of varying degrees of luxury. This trend began in the 1960s and has now grown into a network of hotel barges operating on many of the canals and rivers of France, Belgium, Holland, Germany and the UK.

== History == When refering to travelling on the [[Canal du Midi]] in southern france [[Thomas Jefferson]], then ambassador to France before he became the third President of the United States, wrote to a friend almost 200 years before canal vacations became popular saying "You should not think of returning to America without taking this tour I have taken". However, the practice of converting large barges (i.e. barges generally designed to fit into the locks of canals with minimal remaining volume) only began in 1966 with the Barge Palinurus, converted from carrying coal and captained by Richard Parsons on the canals of the Burgundy region of France. At the time the barge was equipped to take 20 passengers, with only one bath, two showers and two toilets shared between them, cruising on the River Yonne and the [[Burgundy Canal]] (Canal de Bourgogne). The popularity of cruises, particularly amongst American clients, on this new type of boat was improved significantly thanks to the american writer Emily Kimborough and her book 'Floating Island' published in 1968, all about her experiences aboard the Palinurus. The high standards of accomodation expected by American clients rapidly drove the levels of luxury aboard hotel barges upwards. In 1969 Richard Parsons teamed up with Guy Bardet to launch Continental Waterways, a company that eventually ran 15 hotel barges in France. 3 decades later and the market for luxury vacations on floating hotels has grown even further, with over 200 cabins available on french canals alone.

== The 'Barging' Experience == Luxury Hotel barges have been cruising in Europe for over 30 years and are felt by many of their clients to be one of the most enjoyable, relaxing and luxurious ways of experiencing the country. Clients of the barges find that the waterways remain blissfully unspoilt and 'traffic-free'. Usually cruising for a few hours each day, clientsl have time to take in all the sights and sounds, experiencing the wealth of history en route and catching a glimpse of times gone by. Most hotel barges provide excursions in private vehicles that allow clients to enjoy local sights and experience the local culture.

== Types of Hotel Barge Cruise == Hotel Barges come in a wide variety of sizes- some taking just four guests with others over 20 guests, with the size of accomodation varied to suit the physical dimensions of the hull. Levels of luxury range from 'comfortable Bed and Breakfast' right up to '5 star luxury, full board' with pricing to suit.

== Booking a Hotel Barge Holiday == The large number of barges, costs and variables in choice of accomodation mean that several brokers exist to help potential clients find which barge is right for their own vacation. These brokers are often based in the USA, with a few operating much closer to the barges in the UK and in France.

== Sources == (1) France Today Magazine Article "Once Upon a French Canal" [http://www.francetoday.com/travel/guides/barging_guide/once_upon_a_french_canal.html]
(2) The Barge Company Website [http://www.bargecompany.com]

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with ''''Network Intelligence (NI)''' or '''Network Intelligence Technology (NIT)''' builds on the concepts and capabilities of [[Deep Packet Inspection]] (DPI) and [[Bus...'
revision.text:
'''Network Intelligence (NI)''' or '''Network Intelligence Technology (NIT)''' builds on the concepts and capabilities of [[Deep Packet Inspection]] (DPI) and [[Business Intelligence]] (BI) to provide a more immediate and detailed understanding of data that transits communications networks.
NI examines [[Packet_(information_technology)|IP data packets]] in real time by identifying the [communications protocols] used and extracting packet content and [[metadata]] for rapid analysis of data relationships and communications patterns. Its purpose is to harden network [[Computer_security|cyber security]] in enterprise and government environments, streamline current processes, and help businesses develop and manage new products and services that exploit [[Web_2.0|Web 2.0]] and wireless [[3G]] and [[4G]] technologies.
NI extends the advancement of Internet business capabilities, security functions, and Internet [[data mining]]. Advocates of [[net neutrality]] who feared that DPI technology would be used to reduce the openness of the Internet will express the same reservations about NI, while NI advocates will argue that the technology will better protect lawful Internet users, enterprises and governments, and promote economic growth in telecommunications and other industries. NI is currently being incorporated into a wide range of applications by service providers, governments and large enterprises.
== Background == The evolution and growth of [[Internet]] and [[wireless]] technologies offer possibilities for new types of products and services, <ref>{{cite web |author=Aditya Kishore |title=Market Research: New Opportunity for Service Providers? |url=http://www.lightreading.com/document.asp?doc_id=159415 |date=2008-07-21 |publisher=Light Reading |accessdate=2009-07-27}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news |author=Shireen Dee |title=Qosmos Network Intelligence Helps Development of Smart Pipe Solutions |url=http://caas.tmcnet.com/topics/caas-saas/articles/49997-qosmos-network-intelligence-helps-development-smart-pipe-solutions.htm |date=2009-02-03 |publisher=TMCnet |accessdate=2009-07-27}}</ref> as well as opportunities for hackers and criminals to exploit weaknesses and perpetrate [[Computer_crime|cyber crime]]. <ref>{{cite web |title=MessageLabs Intelligence: 2008 Annual Security Report |url=http://www.messagelabs.com/mlireport/MLIReport_Annual_2008_FINAL.pdf |date=2009 |publisher=MessageLabs |accessdate=2009-07-27}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |title=2008 Internet Security Trends |url=http://www.ironport.com/securitytrends/ |date=2008 |publisher=IronPort |accessdate=2009-07-27}}</ref> [[Network_management|Network optimization]] and [[Network_security|security]] solutions therefore need to address the exponential increases in IP traffic, methods of access, types of activity and volume of content generated. <ref>{{cite web |author=Jordan Golson |title=A Brave New World: 700M New Net Users Seen By 2013 |url=http://gigaom.com/2009/07/21/a-brave-new-world-700m-new-net-users-seen-by-2013/#more-59899 |date=2009-07-21 |publisher=GigaOM |accessdate=2009-07-27}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |author=Stacey Higginbotham |title=Will P2P Soon Be the Scourge of Mobile Networks? |url=http://gigaom.com/2009/07/21/will-p2p-soon-be-the-scourge-of-mobile-networks/#more-59491 |date=2009-07-21 |publisher=GigaOM |accessdate=2009-07-27}}</ref> Traditional DPI tools from established vendors like [[Sandvine]] and [[Allot]] have historically addressed network-focused applications such as [[bandwidth management]], [[Network_performance|performance optimization]] and [[Quality of Service]] (QoS). The expansion of real-time data capture and analysis capabilities with NI broadens the timeliness and depth of network visibility from these infrastructure-specific applications to commercial solutions such as mobile analytics, billing and policy management that rely on IP-based networks as platforms.
== Business Intelligence for data networks == In much the same way that BI technology synthesizes business application data from a variety of sources for business visibility and better decision-making, NI technology correlates network traffic data from a variety of data communication vehicles for network visibility, enabling better cyber security and IP services. With ongoing changes in communications networks and how information can be exchanged, people are no longer linked exclusively to physical subscriber lines. The same person can communicate in multiple ways – [[File_Transfer_Protocol|FTP]], [[Webmail]], [[Voice_over_Internet_Protocol|VoIP]], [[instant messaging]], [[online chat]], [[blogs]], [[Social_network_service|social networks]] – and from different access points via desktops, laptops and mobile devices.
NI provides the means to quickly identify, examine and correlate interactions involving Internet users, applications, and protocols whether or not the protocols are [[Tunnelling_protocol|tunneled]] or follow the [[OSI model]]. The technology enables a global understanding of network traffic for applications such as [[Lawful_interception|Lawful Intercept]] and [[Data_leakage_protection|Data Leakage Prevention]] that need to correlate information such as who contacts whom, when where and how, or who accesses what database, when, and the information viewed. When combined with traditional BI tools that examine service quality and customer care, this creates a powerful nexus of subscriber and network data.
== Use in Telecommunications == Telcos, [[Internet_Service_Provider|Internet Service Providers (ISPs)]] and [[Mobile_network_operator|Mobile Network Operators (MNOs)]] are under increasing competitive pressures to move to [[smart pipe]] business models. The cost savings and revenue opportunities driving smart pipe strategies also apply to [[Network_Equipment_Provider|Network Equipment Providers]], [[Independent_software_vendor|Software Vendors]] and [[Systems_integrator|Systems Integrators]] that serve the industry.
Because NI captures detailed information from the hundreds of IP applications that cross mobile networks, it provides the required visibility and analysis of user demand to create and deliver differentiating services, as well as manage usage once deployed.
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Requirement ! Purpose ! Example Applications |- | Customer Metrics | Understand customer demand | *Audience measurement *User behavior analysis *Customer segmentation *Personalized services |- | Network Metrics *services *events | Identify / deliver / manage services | *Bandwidth / resources optimization *Content / application-aware billing *Quality of Experience (QoE) analysis *VoIP fraud monitoring *Regulatory compliance |} <small>NI as enabling technology for smart pipe applications</small>
Customer metrics are especially important for telecom companies to understand consumer behaviors and create personalized IP services. NI enables faster and more sophisticated [[Audience_measurement|Audience Measurement]], User Behavior Analysis, [[Market_segment|Customer Segmentation]], and Personalized Services.
Real-time network metrics are equally important for companies to deliver and manage services. NI classifies protocols and applications from layers 2 through 7, generates metadata for communication sessions, and correlates activity between all layers, applicable for [[Optimization_(computer_science)|Bandwidth & Resource Optimization]], [[Quality_of_service|Quality of Service (QoS)]], Content-Based Billing, [[Quality_of_experience|Quality of Experience (QoE)]], VoIP Fraud Monitoring and [[Regulatory_compliance|Regulatory Compliance]].
== Use in Cloud Computing == The economics and deployment speed of [[cloud computing]] is fueling rapid adoption by companies and government agencies. <ref>{{cite web |title=IDC Finds Cloud Computing Entering Period of Accelerating Adoption and Poised to Capture IT Spending Growth Over the Next Five Years |url=http://idc.com/getdoc.jsp?containerId=prUS21480708 |date=2008-10-20 |publisher=IDC |accessdate=2009-07-28}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |author=Tom Sullivan |title=More Cash for Cloud Computing in 2009 |url=http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/162157/more_cash_for_cloud_computing_in_2009.html |date=2008-03-29 |publisher=PC World |accessdate=2009-07-28}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |author=Henry Sienkiewicz |title=DISA’s Cloud Computing Initiatives |url=http://www.govinfosecurity.com/podcasts.php?podcastID=229 |date=2008-04-30 |publisher=Government Information Security Podcasts |accessdate=2009-07-28}}</ref> Among concerns, however, are risks of [[information security]], [[e-discovery]], [[regulatory compliance]] and [[auditing]]. <ref>{{cite web |author=Ephraim Schwartz |title=The dangers of cloud computing |url=http://www.infoworld.com/d/cloud-computing/dangers-cloud-computing-839 |date=2008-07-07 |publisher=Info World |accessdate=2009-07-28}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |author=Jon Brodkin |title=Gartner: Seven cloud-computing security risks |url=http://www.infoworld.com/d/security-central/gartner-seven-cloud-computing-security-risks-853 |date=2008-07-02 |publisher=Info World |accessdate=2009-07-28}}</ref> NI mitigates the risks by providing [[Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)]],[[Platform_as_a_service|Platform as a Service (PaaS)]] and [[Software_as_a_service|Software as a Service (SaaS)]] vendors with real-time [[situational awareness]] of network activity, and critical transparency to allay fears of potential customers. A vendor can demonstrate hardened network security to prevent [[Data_leakage_protection|Data Leakage]] or [[Data Theft]] and an irrefutable audit trail of all network transaction – communication and content – related to a customer’s account.
== Use in Government == NI correlates information such as who contacts whom, when where and how, or who accesses what database, when and the information viewed, providing [[situational awareness]] for [[Lawful_interception|Lawful Interception]] and [[Cyber_security|Cyber Security]]. Real-time data capture, extraction and analysis allow security specialists to take preventive measures and protect network assets in real time as a complement post-mortem analysis after an attack.
== Use in Business == Because NI combines real-time network monitoring with IP metadata extraction, it enhances the effectiveness of applications for [[Database_security|Database Security]], [[Database_audit|Database Auditing]] and Network Protection. The network visibility afforded by NI can also be used to build enhancements and next-generation solutions for [[Network_performance_management|Network Performance Management]], Network Optimization, [[Customer_experience_management|Customer Experience Management]], [[Content_filtering|Content Filtering]], and internal billing of networked applications.
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Packets]] [[Category:Computer network security]] [[Category:Deep packet inspection]] [[Category:Data analysis]] [[Category:Intelligence (information gathering)]]

revision.text: Saraiki people living abroad have founded an association for people of Saraiki-origin from all over the world. This association has been named as "Saraiki World Association" (سرائیکی عالمی سنگت). The purpose of this association is to share the feelings and problems of Saraiki people from each and every nook and corner of the globe, especially who are away from their homeland.

{{db-person}}'''Brentillo Torres Fuller jr'''<ref>http://www.myspace.com/realnigga13</ref>(born june 10, 1993), better known by his stage name T.J.F Da Dog or Mr.Amazing. Is currently a memeber of [[Young Money Entertainment]]<ref>www.lilwaynehq.com/young-money-entertainment </ref>.
== Early life == ---- Fuller was born in Winston-salem, Forsyth County, North Carolina, the son of Dora maria Green,Brentillo Torres Fuller.His parents divorced when he was young, and he was raised by his mother. He currently go to [[Richard J. Reynolds High School]].
== Career == ---- Startedd rapping in 2007<ref>www.Hotnewhiphop.com</ref> two years and alot of hard work later he sign to [[Young Money Entertainment]].
