{{Non-free use rationale |Article = Man v. Food (season 1) |Description = Cover art for the first season Region 1 release of ''Man v. Food'' from the Travel Channel |Source = http://cdn-1.nflximg.com/us/boxshots/large/7011182
revision.text: == Summary == {{Non-free use rationale |Article = Man v. Food (season 1) |Description = Cover art for the first season Region 1 release of ''Man v. Food'' from the Travel Channel |Source = http://cdn-1.nflximg.com/us/boxshots/large/70111821.jpg |Portion = Only the front cover of the box set |Low_resolution = Yes |Purpose = Infobox |Replaceability = None |other_information = }} == Licensing: == {{Non-free video cover}}

{{infobox tvseason | season_name = Man v. Food '' Season 1 | headercolour = | show_name = ''[[Man v. Food]]'' | image = [[File:ManVFoodSeason1.jpg]] | caption = Season 1 DVD Cover | dvd_release_date = '''[[DVD region code#Region codes and countries|Region 1]]''': October 6, 2009<ref name="s1dvd">{{cite web |publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com |title=Man v. Food - Season 1 |url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Man-v-Food-Season-1/9195 |accessdate=August 11, 2009}}</ref> | dvd_format = | country = [[United States|USA]] | network = [[Travel Channel]] | first_aired = December 3, 2008 | last_aired = March 25, 2009 | num_episodes = 18 | next_season = [[Man v. Food (season 2)|Season 2]] |}}
The '''first season''' of ''Man v. Food'', an American [[food reality television series]] hosted by [[Adam Richman (actor)|Adam Richman]] on the [[Travel Channel]], premiered on December 3, 2008. The series debuted with back-to-back new episodes airing for the first two weeks then settling down to a pattern of one new episode followed by one repeat episode. First-run episodes of the series aired in the United States on the [[Travel Channel]] on Wednesdays at 10:00 PM [[Eastern Time Zone|Eastern time]]. ''Man v. Food'' was executive produced by Matt Sharp, in association with the Travel Channel. The season contains 18 episodes and concluded airing on March 25, 2009.
''Man v. Food'' is hosted by actor and food enthusiast Adam Richman.<ref name="chi9">{{cite news |first=Paige |last=Wiser |work=Chicago Sun-Times |title=Job is easy to stomach for TV show host |url=http://www.suntimes.com/lifestyles/food/1310414,FOO-News-manvfood03.article |date=December 3, 2008}}</ref> In each episode, Richman explores the "big food" of a different American city before facing off against a pre-existing eating challenge at a local restaurant. Over the course of the first season, the final record wound up at 11 wins for "Man" and 7 wins for "Food".
==Reception== ===Ratings=== The first season of ''Man v. Food'' was initially picked up for 10 episodes and then, after initial ratings success, an additional 8 episodes were ordered.<ref name="411in">{{cite news |title=411mania Interviews Man v. Food's Adam Richman |url=http://www.411mania.com/movies/columns/96638/411mania-Interviews-Man-v.-Food\\s-Adam-Richman.htm |first=Al |last=Norton |publisher=411mania |date=February 11, 2009}}</ref> The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' noted that the [[Travel Channel]] received its highest-ever ratings for a new debut with ''Man v. Food''. They highlighted the show as an example of other networks moving in on the traditional turf of the [[Food Network]].<ref>{{cite news |work=Los Angeles Times |title='Chopped': Food Network stirs the pot with entertainment format |first=Rene |last=Lynch |url=http://www.latimes.com/features/food/la-fo-chopped14-2009jan14,0,3717194.story |date=January 14, 2008}}</ref>
===Critical reaction=== ''CityPages Minneapolis/St. Paul'' describes the show, "...like the food version of ''[[Jackass (TV series)|Jackass]]'', with host Adam Richman as its very own [[Steve-O]]."<ref name="cpms1">{{cite news |first=Jessica |last=Chapman |work=CityPages Minneapolis/St. Paul |title=Man v. Food show coming to Minneapolis |url=http://blogs.citypages.com/food/2009/01/man_v_food_show.php |date=January 20, 2009}}</ref> In the ''[[Star-Ledger]]'', television critic Alan Sepinwall wrote, "It ain't deep, and it certainly ain't healthy (I could feel my arteries clog just from watching), but it's fun."<ref>{{cite news |work=The Star-Ledger |title=Me want food! |first=Alan |last=Sepinwall |url=http://www.nj.com/entertainment/tv/index.ssf/2008/12/me_want_food.html |date=December 31, 2008}}</ref>
==Episodes== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Episode !! Episode Number !! Original Air Date |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Amarillo, TX !! 01 !! December 3, 2008 |- |colspan="5"| [[File:Amarillo Texas Big Texan Steak2 2005-05-29.jpg|thumb|right|The Big Texan Steak Ranch]] Adam journeyed down [[U.S. Route 66|Route 66]] to [[Amarillo]] to visit Moose's Sixth St. Bar & Grill for ribs, Biti Pies for dessert, Golden Light Cafe for a [[Frito pie]], Youngblood's Stockyard Café for authentic [[chicken fried steak]], and Coyote Bluff for the extra-spicy "Burger From Hell".<ref name="ama6">{{cite news |work=The Amarillo Globe-News |title='Man v. Food' episodes premiere Wednesday |url=http://www.amarillo.com/stories/113008/fea_11895332.shtml |date=November 30, 2008}}</ref><ref name="am7">{{cite news |first=Aaron D. |last=Langston |publisher=KAMR-TV |title=Man Versus Food |url=http://myhighplains.com/content/fulltext/?cid=35601 |date=December 3, 2008}}</ref> This episode's challenge was to complete the 72-ounce Big Texan challenge at [[The Big Texan Steak Ranch]]<ref>{{cite news |first=Patti |last=Carter |publisher=KFDA NewsChannel 10 |title=Man vs. Food Comes to Amarillo |url=http://www.newschannel10.com/Global/story.asp?S=9454355 |date=December 3, 2008}}</ref> which includes the 4.5 pound (2 kg) steak, a bread roll with butter, baked potato, ranch beans, [[shrimp cocktail]], and a salad.<ref>{{cite news |work=Fort Worth Star Telegram |title=Channel Surfing: Wanna know a secret? |url=http://www.star-telegram.com/movies/story/1070026.html |date=December 3, 2008}}</ref> Accompanied by members of the Route 66 Roller Derby League,<ref name="am7"/> Adam completed the challenge in just 29 of the allotted 60 minutes and was awarded a commemorative t-shirt and had his name placed on the wall of fame.<ref name="boh1">{{cite news |first=Bill |last=Burke |work=The Boston Herald |title=Lot on his plate: Adam Richman takes on all ‘Food’ challengers on new series |url=http://www.bostonherald.com/entertainment/television/general/view.bg?articleid=1136347 |date=December 3, 2008}}</ref> (Approximately 1 in 6 challengers finish in 60 minutes.) Local press coverage places the taping of this challenge on September 29, 2008.<ref name="ama8">{{cite news |work=The Amarillo Globe-News |title=Correction |url=http://www.amarillo.com/stories/092608/new_11346585.shtml |date=September 26, 2008}}</ref> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Memphis, TN !! 02 !! December 3, 2008 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[Memphis]] for an [[Elvis]] sandwich at Arcade, the spicy [[fried chicken]] at Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken, plus the ribs, [[pulled pork]], and shrimp at Charlie Vergos's Rendezvous. This episode's challenge was to eat The Sasquatch Hamburger<ref>{{cite news |first=Louis |last=Peitzman |work=The Daily Californian |title=The Channel Surfer: 12/1-12/7 |url=http://blog.dailycal.org/arts/2008/12/post-390/ |date=December 1, 2008}}</ref>, a total of 7.5 pounds including 4 pounds of beef, 1.5 pounds of vegetables, and a 2 pound bun, at Big Foot Lodge.<ref name="mem4f">{{cite news |first=Blake |last=Fontenay |work=Memphis Commercial Appeal |title=Downtown's Big Foot Lodge settles lawsuit, looks for second location |url=http://www.commercialappeal.com/news/2008/dec/05/time-to-expand/ |date=December 5, 2008}}</ref><ref name="bflc">{{cite web |publisher=Big Foot Lodge LLC |title=Sasquatch Challenge |url=http://www.eatatbigfoot.com/sasquatch-challenge/ |accessdate=December 13, 2008}}</ref> Adam was unable to finish the burger in the time allotted.<ref>{{cite news |first=Tripp |last=Laino |work=Diamondback Online |title=The best food shows you're (probably) not watching |url=http://media.www.diamondbackonline.com/media/storage/paper873/news/2008/12/10/Diversions/The-Best.Food.Shows.Youre.probably.Not.Watching-3575957.shtml |date=December 10, 2008}}</ref> According to the restaurant's website, this challenge was taped on August 1, 2008.<ref name="bfla">{{cite web |publisher=Big Foot Lodge LLC |title=Travel Channel Shoots Big Foot |url=http://www.eatatbigfoot.com/news_article-7192/ |date=August 1, 2008}}</ref> This was the first episode taped for this season.<ref name="ghost"/> As of December 2008, only 5 people have successfully completed the challenge.<ref name="bflh">{{cite web |publisher=Big Foot Lodge LLC |title=Sasquatch Hall of Fame |url=http://www.eatatbigfoot.com/fame_month-1886/ |accessdate=December 13, 2008}}</ref> In mid-December 2008, just two weeks after this episode aired, the names of Big Foot Lodge and the Sasquatch Burger were changed to Kooky Canuck and the Kookamonga, respectively.<ref>{{cite news |work=Memphis Business Journal |title=Big Foot changes name to Kooky Canuck |url=http://memphis.bizjournals.com/memphis/stories/2008/12/15/daily44.html |date=December 19, 2008}}</ref> Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Pittsburgh, PA !! 03 !! December 10, 2008 |- |colspan="5"| [[File:Pittsburgh Strip District Primanti Bros.jpg|thumb|right|Primanti Brothers]] Adam ventured to [[Pittsburgh]]<ref name="lat7">{{cite news |work=Los Angeles Times |title=Television: Wednesday's Highlights |url=http://www.calendarlive.com/tv/cl-et-tvhighlights10-2008dec10,0,771333.story |date=December 10, 2008}}</ref> and [[Primanti Brothers]] for huge sandwiches served with the [[french fries]] and cole slaw inside then Deluca's Restaurant for big omelettes and plate-sized chocolate chip pancakes. This episode's challenge was to complete the Atomic Hot Wings challenge at [[Quaker Steak and Lube]] by consuming 6 "Atomic" [[chicken wings]] in a 150,000 [[Scoville unit]] sauce.<ref>{{cite news |work=Youngstown Vindicator |title=Quaker Steak & Lube featured on Travel Channel |url=http://www.vindy.com/news/2008/dec/16/region/ |date=December 16, 2008}}</ref> Adam completed the challenge in the allotted time and was awarded a commemorative [[bumper sticker]] and a place on Quaker Steak and Lube's "Atomic Wall of Flame".<ref name="gbpg">{{cite news |work=Green Bay Press-Gazette |title=Viewers win battle of "Man v. Food" |first=Thomas |last=Rozwadowski |url=http://www.greenbaypressgazette.com/ic/blogs/channelsurfing/2009/01/viewers-win-battle-of-man-v-food.html |date=January 8, 2009}}</ref> The "liability waiver" Richman signed before eating the wings was dated October 19, 2008. Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Columbus, OH !! 04 !! December 10, 2008 |- |colspan="5"| Adam went to [[Columbus, Ohio]],<ref name="lat7"/> to visit Schmidt's Sausage Haus for [[cream puff]]s and an all-you-can-eat sausage buffet plus the Thurman Cafe' for an enormous [[hamburger]] dubbed "The Thurmanator".<ref name="col1">{{cite news |first=Kevin |last=Joy |work=The Columbus Dispatch |title=Sandwich draws TV show |url=http://www.columbusdispatch.com/live/content/life/stories/2008/12/10/1A_DAGWOOD.ART_ART_12-10-08_D1_BKC6CNC.html?sid=101 |date=December 10, 2008}}</ref> This episode's challenge was to eat the 2 1/2 pound [[Dagwood sandwich|Dagwood Sandwich]] challenge (plus a full pound of french fries) at the Ohio Deli & Restaurant.<ref name="col1"/><ref name="jau3">{{cite news |work=Jaunted |url=http://www.jaunted.com/story/2008/12/2/8579/11610/travel/Man+v.+Food%3A+If+You+Don't+Puke%2C+It's+Free |title=Man v. Food: If You Don't Puke, It's Free |date=December 2, 2008}}</ref> Before facing the challenge, he psyched himself up with a fantasy sequence involving the [[Ohio State Buckeyes]] [[Brutus Buckeye|mascot]] and cheerleaders at [[Ohio Stadium]]. Adam completed the challenge in just 20 of the allotted 30 minutes and was awarded a commemorative t-shirt. As of December 2008, about 400 of the more than 1000 challengers to date have completed the challenge.<ref name="col1"/> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Austin, TX !! 05 !! December 17, 2008 |- |colspan="5"| Adam headed west to the [[Texas Hill Country]] to make and devour giant [[doughnut]]s at Round Rock Donuts in [[Round Rock, Texas|Round Rock]] and sample the meats from the open pit at [http://www.saltlickbbq.com/ Salt Lick BBQ] in [[Driftwood, Texas|Driftwood]]. This episode's challenge was to eat 8 of the Don Juan El Taco Grande breakfast tacos at Juan in a Million in [[Austin, Texas]].<ref name="aus43">{{cite web |work=Austin Matters |title="Man v. Food", The Travel Channel takes on Juan in a Million |first=Ralph |last=Barrera |url=http://ralphbarrera.wordpress.com/2008/09/25/man-v-food-the-travel-channel-takes-on-juan-in-a-million/ |date=September 25, 2008}}</ref> Adam finished only four-and-a-quarter of the three-quarter pound concoctions of potato, egg, cheese, and bacon all wrapped in a [[tortilla]] but was rewarded with posting of his name and photo on the "Juan of Fame" as the first "Celebrity Champ" and one of the top five all-time eaters.<ref name="gbpg"/><ref name="aas4r">{{cite news |work=Austin American-Statesman |title=Man versus tacos |date=September 26, 2008 |page=B03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.juaninamillion.com/ |title=Juan In A Million Restaurant and Catering |accessdate=December 13, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |work=Pickaxe and Roll |title=The Adam Richman game |first=Nate |last=Timmons |publisher=SB Nation |url=http://www.pickaxeandroll.com/2009/3/19/803691/game-69-recap-nuggets-111 |date=March 19, 2009}}</ref> Local press coverage puts the filming of this challenge on September 25, 2008,<ref name="aas4r"/> just before the Amarillo challenge.<ref name="aus43"/> The date on the posted photo was September 25, 2008. Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Chicago, IL !! 06 !! December 24, 2008 |- |colspan="5"| [[File:ginoseastdeepdish.jpg|thumb|right|A Gino's East [[deep dish pizza]]]] Adam traveled to [[Chicago]] to visit [[Al's Beef]] for [[Italian beef]] sandwiches and [[Gino's East]] for [[deep dish pizza]].<ref name="chi9"/><ref>{{cite news |work=Los Angeles Times |url=http://www.calendarlive.com/tv/cl-et-tvhighlights24-2008dec24,0,4834575.story |title=Wednesday's Highlights |date=December 24, 2008}}</ref> At Al's Beef, after learning the official "Italian stance" for eating such a juicy sandwich, Richman completed a double-meat, double-cheese [[Reuben sandwich]] in under 30 minutes.<ref name="chi9"/> This episode's main challenge was to eat three overstuffed sandwiches stacked with fries inside, in less than one hour, at Lucky's Sandwich Company.<ref>{{cite news |first=Prescott |last=Carlson |work=Chicagoist |title=Sunday Afternoon Diversion: Man v. Chicago Food |url=http://chicagoist.com/2008/12/28/sunday_afternoon_diversion_man_vs_c.php |date=December 28, 2008}}</ref> Lucky's is named for [[Charles Weeghman|"Lucky" Charlie Weeghman]] who once owned a part of the [[Chicago Cubs]] and built what is now called [[Wrigley Field]]<ref>{{cite web |publisher=Metromix Chicago |title=Lucky's Sandwich Company |url=http://chicago.metromix.com/restaurants/restaurant/luckys-sandwich-company-wrigleyville/145057/content |accessdate=December 26, 2008}}</ref> although the restaurant itself is in no way connected to the descendants of Lucky Charlie Weeghman or to the Chicago Cubs.<ref>{{cite pressrelease |title=Overstuffed Sandwich Arrives in Wrigleyville Luckys Sandwich Company Announces Grand Opening |url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2004/06/prweb136813.htm |date=June 26, 2004}}</ref> Adam completed the challenge within the allotted time and became just the 11th person to have his photo posted on the Wall of Fame. Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Atlanta, GA !! 07 !! January 7, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[Atlanta]], where he went to college, to visit [[Gladys Knight & Ron Winans' Chicken & Waffles]] for homemade food, plus The Vortex Bar & Grill for their famous hamburgers.<ref name="cla1">{{cite news |first=Debbie |last=Michaud |work=Creative Loafing |title=Travel Channel’s ‘Man v. Food’ takes on Atlanta |url=http://blogs.creativeloafing.com/omnivore/2009/01/07/travel-channels-man-v-food-takes-on-atlanta/ |date=January 7, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |work=The Atlanta Journal-Constitution |title=Season premieres include “24”, “Scrubs” and “Nip/Tuck” |url=http://www.accessatlanta.com/entertainment/content/entertainment/stories/2009/01/05/tv_best_bets_january_premiers.html?imw=Y |date=January 5, 2009}}</ref> Adam spent time in the kitchen with [[Gladys Knight]] (he described himself as a "white [[The Pips|Pip]]") making a [[chicken and waffles]] plate named "The Midnight Train" in honor of [[Midnight Train to Georgia|the song Knight made famous]]. This episode's challenge is to eat a 30-inch, 11-pound Carnivore Challenge Pizza in one hour at Big Pie in the Sky Pizzeria without having the pizza leave the body.<ref name="jau3"/><ref name="cla1"/> The pizza consists of six pounds of crust and sauce plus five pounds of pepperoni, ground beef, Italian sausage, ham, and bacon.<ref name="carn">{{cite web |publisher=Big Pie in the Sky New York Style Pizzeria |title=The Carnivore Challenge |url=http://bigpieinthesky.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=8&Itemid=8 |accessdate=January 15, 2009}}</ref> Because the pizza is so large, the restaurant has set this as a two-person challenge. Adam recruited Drew, a veteran of the Carnivore Challenge, to help him. With a prize of $250 in prize money on the line,<ref name="carn"/> Adam finished most of his half of the pizza, but Drew eventually vomited most of his half pizza, losing the challenge for them both. At the time of this episode's taping, the challenge had never been successfully completed by anyone; later in 2009, it was beaten for the first time ever by Erik Unger and Anthony Reganato<ref name="myref37">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigpieinthesky.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=8&Itemid=8|title=Carnivore Challenge|accessdate=2009-05-25|year=2009|author=Pizzeria, Big Pie in the Sky|format=HTML|language=English}}</ref>. Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Boston, MA !! 08 !! January 14, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam journeyed to [[Boston]] to visit the East Coast Grill & Raw Bar for seafood and a super-spicy feast dubbed "Hell Night"<ref name="bosh">{{cite news |work=The Boston Herald |title=Tracked down: Matt Damon, Mel Gibson, Robin Williams... |url=http://www.bostonherald.com/track/inside_track/view.bg?articleid=1128453 |date=October 29, 2008}}</ref> and The Barking Crab for a a four-pound [[clambake]]. This episode's challenge was to eat a 12-pound Eagle's Challenge Burger, which includes 5 pounds of hamburger, 2 pounds of bacon and cheese, 5 pounds of fries, and a giant pickle, at Eagle's Deli and Restaurant.<ref>{{cite news |work=The Boston Globe |title="Man v. Food" in Boston |url=http://www.boston.com/lifestyle/food/dishing/2009/01/man_v_food_in_b.html |date=January 12, 2009}}</ref> ''Boston'' magazine awarded Eagle's Deli their "Best of Boston 2006 Burger" honor<ref>{{cite news |work=Boston Magazine |title=Best of Boston 2006 |url=http://www.bostonmagazine.com/best_of/detail/best_of_boston_2006_burger}}</ref> and the Travel Channel named it one of the "World's Best Places to Pig Out".<ref>{{cite web |first=Jason |last=Robey |publisher=Travel Channel |title=World's Best Places to Pig Out |url=http://www.travelchannel.com/ideas/picks/ci.Eagle's_Deli.artTravelIdeasFmt?vgnextfmt=artTravelIdeasFmt&ch=0d685934dc165110VgnVCM1000009f183e0aRCRD&initArticlevgnextoid=b10c007f2cee6110VgnVCM100000698b3a0aRCRD |accessdate=December 25, 2008}}</ref> Adam, a self-proclaimed [[New York Yankees]] fan, faced off against a former Eagle's employee, Chuck Whittall, a [[Boston Red Sox]] fan (He even got help from Red Sox first baseman [[Kevin Youkilis]]). Chuck finished 6 oz. more of his burger and fries than Adam. Adam lost the challenge and was forced to wear an "I Love Boston" shirt and got his picture on the Wall of Shame. Local press reports place the taping of this episode in late October 2008.<ref name="bosh"/> As of January 2009, more than 1,500 have tried but no one person has successfully completed the Challenge Burger.<ref>{{cite web |work=A Hamburger Today |title=Tonight on 'Man v. Food,' the Eagle's Deli Burger Challenge in Boston |url=http://aht.seriouseats.com/archives/2009/01/tonight-on-man-v-food-the-eagles-deli-burger-challenge-in-boston.html |date=January 14, 2009}}</ref> In a March 2009 interview, after the end of season one, Richman contested the loss over issues of portion size and the preparation of the burgers while noting that Whittall was "not a noble contestant".<ref name="ghost">{{cite news |work=Rock & Roll Ghost |title=Interview: Travel Channel's Man V. Food Host Adam Richman |url=http://rockandrollghost.blogspot.com/2009/03/interview-travel-channels-man-v-food.html |date=March 26, 2009}}</ref> Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! New York, NY !! 09 !! January 21, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| [[File:Sylvias-restaurant1.jpg|thumb|right|Sylvia's Restaurant of Harlem]] Adam went home to [[New York City]] to visit [[Sylvia's Restaurant of Harlem]] for homemade food and [[Katz's Delicatessen]] for their famous deli sandwiches.<ref>{{cite news |first=Diane |last=Werts |work=Newsday |title=Off the wall |url=http://www.newsday.com/services/newspaper/printedition/wednesday/partii/ny-etwall6005556jan21,0,6775361.story |date=January 21, 2009}}</ref> This episode's challenge was to eat [[Phall|Spicy P'haal]], claimed to be "the hottest curry in the world", at Brick Lane Curry House and be added to the restaurant's "P'hall of Fame".<ref name="jau3"/><ref>{{cite web |author=McCluskey and Miller |work=Defamer |title=Tell Us Sweet Little Lies |url=http://defamer.com/5136641/tell-us-sweet-little-lies |date=January 21, 2009}}</ref> The owner of Brick Lane warned Adam that one time during the challenge a person actually started bleeding from the nose. Despite this and the pain from the curry (Adam made the mistake of wiping his face with the napkin he used to wipe his mouth), Adam finished the curry, got a complimentary beer, a certificate of completion, and his picture on the restaurant's website. Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! New Orleans, LA !! 10 !! January 28, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[New Orleans]] to visit Mother's Restaurant for a "Ferdie Special" [[po' boy]] sandwich and Deanie's Seafood for barbecued shrimp.<ref>{{cite news |first=Dave |last=Walker |work=New Orleans Times-Picayune |title=Travel Channel's 'Man v. Food' comes to New Orleans |url=http://blog.nola.com/davewalker/2009/01/travel_channel_show_comes_to_n.html |date=January 27, 2009}}</ref> This episode's challenge was to finish 15 dozen oysters at Acme Oyster House and join the "15 Dozen Club". Adam succeeded in this challenge as he slurped all 15 dozen oysters. As of the time of the taping in December, only 28 of the 150 people who had attempted this feat had succeeded.<ref name="ghost"/> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Portland, OR !! 11 !! February 4, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam journeyed to [[Portland, Oregon]], to visit the historic Stepping Stone Cafe for 13-inch [[pancake]]s known as "mancakes" and [[Voodoo Doughnut]] which features more than 70 varieties of doughnut, including a [[maple bar|maple bacon bar]] with real bacon on top. While at Voodoo Doughnut, Adam prepared doughnuts and witnessed a wedding held in the doughnut shop. The episode's main challenge was at Salvador Molly's "Great Balls of Fire" challenge—five habanero chile cheese fritters covered in [[habanero chile]] sauce. If Richman succeeded—and only 50 of the 1000 that attempted this in 2008 did—he would get his picture on the "Wall of Flame".<ref name="ef1">{{cite news |first=OJ |last=Rifkin |work=EatFeats |title=Man vs. Food episodes #11-#17 air dates and sites |url=http://eatfeats.com/man-vs-food-episodes-11-17-air-dates-and-sites.html |date=January 24, 2009}}</ref> After psyching himself up dressed as a pirate in a fantasy sequence, Adam had no problems completing this challenge. A press release from Salvador Molly's states the challenge was taped on December 9, 2008.<ref>{{cite pressrelease |publisher=Salvador Molly's |title=Travel Channel @ Salvador Molly's |url=http://www.salvadormollys.com/News/161/Details/ |date=December 5, 2009}}</ref> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Seattle, WA !! 12 !! February 11, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[Seattle, Washington]], for a December 13 stop at Red Mill Burgers for a double bacon deluxe [[cheeseburger]] and onion rings<ref name="tvgm">{{cite news |work=TV Guide |title=Man v. Food: TV Listings |url=http://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/man-v-food/tv-listings/295939 |accessdate=January 29, 2009}}</ref><ref name="pwh4">{{cite web |work=PhinneyWood |title='Man vs. Food' filming at Red Mill |url=http://www.phinneywood.com/2008/12/13/man-vs-food-filming-at-red-mill/ |date=December 13, 2008}}</ref>, to The Crab Pot in Seattle's historic waterfront district for their signature "Captain's Combo" of shrimp, clam strips, calamari, cod, and halibut, plus a challenge taped on December 14, 2008, at [[Beth's Cafe]], in which Adam went up against the "Southwestern Exposure" 12-egg [[omelet]].<ref>{{cite web |work=Outrageous Malfunction |title=Man versus Food @ Beth’s Cafe |url=http://blog.ryjones.org/2008/12/14/man-versus-food-beths-cafe/ |date=December 14, 2008}}</ref> The omelet, which includes beef brisket chili, salsa, sour cream, and cheddar cheese, weighs roughly five pounds and is served on a pizza platter. On average, only one person in ten is able to complete the challenge and win a Beth's Cafe t-shirt. This episode's challenge was complicated by the addition of a race against a local competitor, also named Adam, who had previously beaten this challenge.<ref>{{cite news |first=Ronald |last=Holden |work=Seattle Global Gourmet Examiner |title=Man v Food comes to Seattle |url=http://www.examiner.com/x-342-Seattle-Global-Gourmet-Examiner~y2009m2d10-Man-v-Food-comes-to-Seattle |date=February 10, 2009}}</ref> In the end, neither "West Coast Adam" nor "East Coast Adam" (Richman) was able to finish the challenge with Richman unable to finish the last "2-3 bites."<ref>{{cite news |work=Seattlest |title=Food Is Our Friend, Right? |url=http://seattlest.com/2009/02/10/food_is_our_friend_right.php |date=February 10, 2009}}</ref> Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Los Angeles, CA !! 13 !! February 18, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| [[File:120207-LA-Philippes.jpg|thumb|right|Philippe the Original]] Adam travelled to [[Los Angeles, California]], to take on the Goliath Manuel's Special and [[machaca]] burritos at El Tepeyac Café in East L.A., [[French dip sandwich]]es at [[Philippe's|Philippe the Original]] near Union Station, plus the "hot ramen challenge" at Orochon Ramen in [[Little Tokyo, Los Angeles, California|Little Tokyo]].<ref name="lat5w">{{cite news |first=Whitney |last=Friedlander |work=Los Angeles Times |title=Travel Channel’s Adam Richman digs into ‘Man v. Food’ |url=http://travel.latimes.com/daily-deal-blog/index.php/man-v-food-travel-ch-3872/ |date=January 27, 2009}}</ref> Any person who can finish the serving of Special No. 2, a spicy soup featuring 10 kinds of chilies, is awarded a place on the Wall of Bravery.<ref name="lat5w"/> Richman was able to complete the challenge. The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' reports that Richman was in town in late January.<ref name="lat5w"/> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! St. Louis, MO !! 14 !! February 25, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam journeyed to [[St. Louis, Missouri]], to attempt the $35 "Big Ben" meal at Pappy's Smokehouse which includes a full slab of ribs, 2 sandwiches, a quarter-chicken, and 4 side dishes.<ref name="fea2v">{{cite news |first=George |last=Mahe |work=Feast |title=Richman vs Pappy's |url=http://stlmagblogs.typepad.com/feast/2008/12/richman-vs-pappys.html |date=December 5, 2008}}</ref> Local press reports state this taping took place on December 18, 2008.<ref name="fea2v"/> He also stopped at Iron Barley to try a Monte Cristo hotdog.<ref name="slpd2">{{cite news |first=Joe |last=Bonwich |work=St. Louis Post-Dispatch |title=“Man v. Food” St. Louis episode: Wed. 9 p.m. |url=http://www.stltoday.com/blogzone/off-the-menu/uncategorized/2009/02/man-v-food-st-louis-episode-wed-9-pm/ |date=February 24, 2009}}</ref> The episode's main challenge was the Malt Milkshake Challenge at [[Crown Candy Kitchen]]. To win, Adam had to drink five 24-ounce malt [[milkshake]]s in 30 minutes, a challenge offered by the restaurant since 1913.<ref name="ef1"/><ref name="slpd2"/> The milkshakes were divided into 15 8-ounce glasses for Adam. Adam started strong but he ended up running to the bathroom to vomit it out after drinking 12 out of the 15 glasses.<ref>{{cite news |first=Bernie |last=Miklasz |work=St. Louis Post-Dispatch |title=5 Minutes for Blogging, Feb. 26 |url=http://www.stltoday.com/blogzone/bernies-extra-points/bernies-extra-points/2009/02/5-minutes-for-blogging-feb-26/ |date=February 26, 2009 |quote=[H]ost Adam Richman went down for the count on “Man vs. Food” when he took on the Crown Candy Kitchen challenge of drinking five malted milkshakes in 30 minutes. You don’t mess with my boy Andy Candy.}}</ref> As a result of this episode, Pappy's Smokehouse reported a spike in traffic on their website and increased business from the national exposure, even on [[Ash Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite news |first=George |last=Mahe |work=St. Louis Magazine |title=Next Stop: "It's So Busy Nobody Goes There" |url=http://stlmagblogs.typepad.com/feast/2009/02/next-stop-its-so-busy-nobody-goes-there-.html |date=February 27, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/gutcheck/2009/02/crown_candy_kitchen_pappys_smokehouse_iron_barley_man_v_food_live_st_louis_food_blog_022509.php |first=Ian |last=Froeb |work=Riverfront Times |title=St. Louis Episode of Man v. Food Live Blog |date=February 25, 2009}}</ref> Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! San Jose, CA !! 15 !! March 4, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[San Jose, California]], where he visited Iguana's Taqueria and Henry's Hi Life. Iguana's is the home of "BurritoZilla", a five pound (2.3 kg), 18-inch (46 cm) burrito that takes several tortillas to construct.<ref>{{cite news |work=San Jose Mercury News |title=Downtown and super hungry? Iguanas' BurritoZilla is for you |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/entertainment/ci_11993007 |date=March 25, 2009}}</ref> This week's challenge was to complete the Hellfire Hot Wing Challenge at SmokeEaters Hot Wings.<ref name="ef1"/> To win, Adam ate 12 hot wings soaked in [[habanero chili]] sauce within 10 minutes—and then had to wait another 5 minutes before eating or drinking anything else to relieve the heat. Richman was able to complete the challenge successfully, but was in pain from the habanero chili sauce. The episode featured a guest appearance by [[competitive eating]] champion [[Joey Chestnut]].<ref name="tvsj">{{cite news |first=Veronica |last=Santiago |work=TV Envy |title=This Week on TV (3/2-3/8) |url=http://television.gearlive.com/tvenvy/article/q107-this-week-on-tv-3-2-3-8/ |date=March 1, 2009}}</ref> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Denver, CO !! 16 !! March 11, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam ventured to [[Denver, Colorado]], for burgers, steaks, and burritos. The show taped on January 20, 2009 at Duffy's Cherry Cricket where Richman had waitresses toss darts to determine which toppings he put on his special "Man v. Food Burger."<ref name="denp2">{{cite news |first=Kristen |last=Browning-Blas |work=Denver Post |title=Man v. Food shooting in Denver today and tomorrow |url=http://blogs.denverpost.com/thefoodsection/2009/01/21/man-v-food-shooting-in-denver-today-and-tomorrow/ |date=January 21, 2009}}</ref> The production team spent 8 hours at the restaurant.<ref>{{cite news |first=Patricia |last=Calhoun |work=Westword |title=Denver's best burgers go big time |url=http://blogs.westword.com/cafesociety/2009/01/denvers_best_burgers_go_big_ti.php |date=January 20, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Penny |last=Parker |work=Rocky Mountain News |title=Plenty of ways to party hearty for new prez |url=http://www.rockymountainnews.com/news/2009/jan/20/parker-plenty-of-ways-to-party-hearty-for-new/ |date=January 20, 2009}}</ref> (Bacon, a [[fried egg]], [[guacamole]], salsa, smoked cheddar, and grilled [[Sweet onion|Bermuda onions]] were the randomly chosen toppings.)<ref name="denp2"/> The ''[[Denver Post]]'' further reported that he would be taping at The Buckhorn Exchange steakhouse on January 21 and Jack-n-Grill for New Mexican food on January 22.<ref name="denp2"/> The ''[[Rocky Mountain News]]'' reports that ''Man v. Food'' would tape at Jack-n-Grill in Denver on January 22, 2009, as Adam Richman faced off against a "7-pound monster breakfast burrito".<ref>{{cite news |work=Rocky Mountain News |title=Understudies save the day |first=Penny |last=Parker |url=http://www.rockymountainnews.com/news/2009/jan/09/parker-understudies-save-the-day/ |date=January 9, 2009}}</ref> If successful, Richman would get his picture up on the restaurant's Wall of Fame.<ref>{{cite news |first=Patricia |last=Calhoun |work=Westword |title=Jack-n-Grill gets its fifteen minutes -- and seven pounds -- of fame |url=http://blogs.westword.com/cafesociety/2009/01/jack-n-grill_gets_its_fifteen.php |date=January 19, 2009}}</ref> Richman was only able to finish two-thirds of the challenge before surrendering.<ref name="rmn3">{{cite news |first=Penny |last=Parker |work=Rocky Mountain News |title=Massive burrito wins by a TKO |url=http://www.rockymountainnews.com/news/2009/jan/23/parker-massive-burrito-wins-by-a-tko/ |date=January 23, 2009}}</ref><ref name="dw311">{{cite news |first=Patricia |last=Calhoun |work=Denver Westword |title=Spoiler alert: Sometimes you get the burrito and sometimes the burrito gets you |url=http://blogs.westword.com/cafesociety/2009/03/spoiler_alert_sometimes_you_ge.php |date=March 11, 2009}}</ref> The restaurant offers any man who can finish the combination of 8 eggs, 1 pound of cheese, 1 pound of green chili, and 1.5 pounds of potatoes, that the $12 price of the meal will be waived.<ref name="rmn3"/> However, any woman who can complete the challenge is offered the right to dine there "for free forever".<ref name="rmn3"/><ref name="dw311"/> Winner: '''Food''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! North Carolina !! 17 !! March 18, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[North Carolina]], to check out Time Out in [[Chapel Hill, North Carolina|Chapel Hill]] then on to The Pit in [[Raleigh, North Carolina|Raleigh]] to cook a pig with "local legend" Ed Mitchell.<ref name="nr1">{{cite news |work=New Raleigh |title=Travel Channel’s Man v. Food To Visit Raleigh Eateries |url=http://www.newraleigh.com/articles/archive/travel-channels-man-v.-food-to-visit-raleigh-eateries/ |date=January 22, 2009}}</ref> As this week's main challenge, Adam tried to eat 17 hot dogs (including 17 buns, half a pint of [[mustard (condiment)|mustard]], and one pint of [[chili sauce]]) to complete the Hot Dogger Eating Challenge in record time at The Roast Grill.<ref name="ef1"/><ref name="nr1"/> Opened in 1940 by the grandparents of current owner George Poniros, The Roast Grill is noted for refusing to serve ketchup.<ref name="gig3">{{cite news |work=The News & Observer |title=A hot dogger proves he can still kick buns; Gabe Gigliotti returns to Raleigh to reclaim his title as champ |first=Andrea |last=Weigl |url=http://www.newsobserver.com/105/story/1449095.html |date=March 19, 2009}}</ref> The previous record of 16 hot dogs in 50 minutes had been set on August 14, 2008, by Gabe Gigliotti.<ref name="gig3"/> Adam wore [[North Carolina Tar Heels]] and [[Duke Blue Devils]] wristbands plus an [[NC State Wolfpack]] headband for the challenge.<ref>{{cite news |first=Andrea |last=Weigl |work=Raleigh News & Observer |title=Roast Grill dogs lure celebrity; 'Man v. Food' takes on a local specialty |url=http://www.newsobserver.com/347/story/1393032.html |date=February 4, 2009}}</ref> According to local press reports, the visit to The Pit was taped on January 28, 2009, and challenge at The Roast Grill was taped on January 30.<ref name="nr2">{{cite news |work=New Raleigh |title=UPDATE: Man v. Food dates change |url=http://www.newraleigh.com/articles/archive/update-man-v.-food-dates-change/ |date=January 26, 2009}}</ref> Adam completed the challenge in about 30 minutes, and as the winner, re-named it the "''Man v. Food'' Hot Dog Challenge". (Gigliotti returned about a month after the filming of this episode and set a new record of 18 hot dogs in 23 minutes on March 6, 2009, and returned it back to its original name.)<ref name="gig3"/> Winner: '''Man''' |- |colspan="6" bgcolor="#336666"| <!-- Episode space --> |- ! Minneapolis, MN !! 18 !! March 25, 2009 |- |colspan="5"| Adam traveled to [[Minneapolis, Minnesota]], in February to tape the season finale. In January 2009, ''CityPages Minneapolis/St. Paul'' and [[Andrew Zimmern]] reported that Richman would be in town to tape the show from February 5 through February 8, 2009.<ref name="cpms1"/><ref name="azms">{{cite news |first=Andrew |last=Zimmern |work=Mpls.St.Paul Magazine |title=Chow & Again: Man v. Food |url=http://blogs.mspmag.com/chowandagain/2009/01/post.html |date=January 15, 2009}}</ref> Richman visited "everything from [[Jucy Lucy|Juicy Lucy]] joints to the brewski at local beer bars" and was escorted by fellow Travel Channel host Andrew Zimmern to rotisserie specialists Brasa Premium Rotisserie Restaurant to "see if he can eat everything on the steam table in one sitting."<ref name="azms"/> In an interview given during the taping of the North Carolina episode, Adam told the reporter, "I'm about to go to Minneapolis where a certain adorable, cuddly bald bear named Andrew Zimmern will be appearing on my show."<ref name="411in"/> Despite an initial press report of a rumor that taping had been cancelled, filming occurred on February 4 at Matt's Bar, on February 6 at the historic 5-8 Club for a Juicy Lucy, and on February 7 at Gasthof zur Gemutlichkeit & Mario's Keller Bar for a giant [[bratwurst]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Jessica |last=Chapman |url=http://blogs.citypages.com/food/2009/02/man_v_minn_no_m.php |work=The Hot Dish |title=Man v. Minn.: GAME ON! |date=February 7, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Kevin |last=Hoffman |url=http://blogs.citypages.com/food/2009/02/man_vs_food_vis.php |work=The Hot Dish |title=Man vs. Food visits 5-8 Club, Gasthof |date=February 9, 2009}}</ref> Gasthof offers a Meterbratwurst, a grilled German [[Bratwurst]] one meter (just over three feet) in length and served with two side items (Adam chose red cabbage and potato croquettes), and anyone who completes the meal is awarded a certificate. Adam completed the challenge with no problem and he received the certificate.<ref>{{cite news |first=Rachel |last=Hutton |title=Man vs. Food Minneapolis airs tonight |work=Minneapolis/St. Paul City Pages |url=http://blogs.citypages.com/food/2009/03/man_vs_food_min.php |date=March 25, 2009}}</ref> Winner: '''Man''' |}
==References== {{reflist}}

The '''PowerSwim''' is a device somewhat like two pairs of long thin airplane wings which are fastened to a [[scuba diver]]'s hips and legs: the longer pair (about {{convert|6|ft|m}} wide or a bit less) at the hips and the shorter pair at the ankles. It was developed by [[DARPA]] in 2007. It is claimed to let a [[scuba diver]] or [[frogman]] swim much faster (250%) than with [[swimfin]]s for the same amount of bodily effort, if used correctly, and being not motorized, it makes no motor noise to be heard by hostile [[hydrophone]]s. It works somewhat like a [[penguin]]'s or [[plesiosaur]]'s side-mounted flippers. Its estimated cost is less than $500. The diver uses it by moving his legs up and down together like with a [[monofin]]. It is claimed that the length of the front wing lets it operate outside the cone of [[wake]] that starts at the diver's shoulders.
Likely disadvantages: *The width of the device would make it difficult to go through narrow gaps or near alongside something. *It ties the diver's feet together.
==Aqueon== '''Aqueon'' or '''Aqueaon''' was a similar device to PowerSwim. It was primarily developed in the 1970s by the [[Innerspace Corporation]], an aquatic propulsion company which specialized in [[submersible]] thrusters at the time. The first working Aqueon unit was sold in 1979. Its original designer was [[California Institute of Technology]] graduate Calvin "Cal" Gongwer. It was claimed to provide three times as much thrust as conventional [[Swimfin|swimming fins]] and up to six times as much power, and that from a stationary start, a swimmer covered 25 yards in 8.4 seconds using Aqueon, and that with an Aqueon the swimmer covered 1500 yards with [[scuba equipment]] in 24 minutes; the fastest time covered by the same diver with scuba equipment and fins was 44 minutes.
==External links== *http://www.origin.popularmechanics.com/technology/military_law/4223354.html Image and description *http://www.darpa.mil/dso/thrusts/bio/biologically/powerswim/index.htm *http://gizmodo.com/gadgets/military/darpas-powerswim-brings-out-the-aquaman-in-you-318195.php Images and description *http://www.slate.com/id/2171923/entry/2171925/ *http://www.innerspacethrusters.com/Aqueon.htm Information on this 35 or so year old idea
[[Category:Diving equipment]]

'''Rykaipiy''' ({{lang-ru|Рыркайпий}}) is a rural locality just to the west of [[Mys Shmidta]] in the [[Shmidtovsky District]] ([[Raion]]) of the [[Chukotka Autonomous Okrug]], part of the [[Far Eastern Federal District|Far Eastern]] [[federal districts of Russia|Federal District]] of [[Russia]].
The village is a small settlement, population as of 2003: 324 <ref name="chukotka"> [http://redcross-chukotka.ru/English/modules.php?name=Content&pa=showpage&pid=17] Red Cross Chukotka </ref>, most of whom are of [[Chukchi]] descent. The name of the village means "''Place of the Walrus''" in [[Chukchi language|Chukchi]], <ref name="capetocape.org.uk">[http://www.capetocape.org.uk/Marker%20pages/Schmidta.htm] capetocape.org.uk </ref>, or "''Walrus Jam''" <ref name="chukotka" />, to convey the meaning that there are regularly large numbers of [[Walrus]] in the vicinity. Unsurprisingly, marine hunting has traditionally been a key source of food and employment for the local indigenous people <ref name="chukotka" />.
As with several of the rural settlements thorughout Chukotka, Rykaipiy was the centre for a [[collectivization in the USSR|collectivised]] farm centred around [[reindeer]]. Indeed it was the central farmstead for the largest of all the reindeer herding famrs thorughout Chukotka, named ''Pioneer''. Unlike other rural settlements in Chukotka such as [[Alkatvaam]] in [[Beringovsky District]] and [[Tavaivaam]] in [[Anadyrsky District]], following the [[History of the Soviet Union (1985–1991)|collapse of the Soviet Union]] and payments to the farms from the government effectively ceased as Russia moved to a [[market economy]], the workers on this farm were able to keep their reindeer herds going and these herds are still the major source of employment for the local people, despite living on the coast <ref name="chukotka" />.
As with many Chukotkan villages, there are strong efforts made to keep the traditions of the indigenous peoples alive and although Rykaipiy has modern facilities in the shape of a hospital, post office, high school and daycare centre there is also a traditional [[Chukchi]] ensemble and cultural centre and Northern Star Native Womens Club <ref name="chukotka" />.
==References== {{reflist}}
==See Also==
*[[Billings, Chukotka Autonomous Okrug|Billings]] - Rural locality *[[Leningradsky]] - [[Urban-type settlement]] in the district *[[Mys Shmidta]] - The administrative centre for the district *[[Pil'gyn]] - Rural locality *[[Ushakovskoye]] - Rural locality on [[Wrangel Island]]

revision.text:
{{refimproveBLP|date=August 2009}} '''Bethany Kennedy Scanlon''', born March 21, 1975 in [[Houston]], [[Texas]], is a bestselling author and is well known for her bible study ''Want to find your mate?'' and book ''Where’s my mate?''
Leaving home at sixteen years old, Bethany became an entertainer in Gentlemen’s Clubs for approximately five years, in [[Houston]], [[New Orleans]], [[Ft. Walton Beach]] and [[Panama City]]. During that time she met and married a man in [[New Orleans]], [[Louisiana]]. Their marriage was short lived and after divorcing, she moved back to [[Houston]], [[Texas]], where she met her current husband, Lucas Scanlon. Prior to living in [[New Orleans]], Bethany lived in [[Ft. Walton Beach]] and [[Destin]], [[Florida]]. Bethany Scanlon attended Ft. Walton Beach High School her senior year, graduating in 1994. She also lived for two years with her father and step family in a suburb of [[Chicago]] during her middle school years.
Bethany has toured hosting book signings at [[Barnes and Noble]], [[Books a Million]], [[Hastings]] and [[Borders]] around different parts of the [[United States]]. Her popular titles also include Searching for Liberty, Grace and Destiny, Secrets of an Undercover Agent, Silly Women and The Prosperity Preacher.
Also known as "The Internet Preacher", Bethany K. Scanlon continues to write fiction novels, [[Bible]] studies and inspirational books.
Bethany K. Scanlon has been featured on several radio shows and continues to tour with her husband, Lucas Scanlon, whom she married on July 7, 2001. Lucas and Bethany Scanlon own and operate the publishing company Planet Teach Publications.
== References ==
<references>http://www.librarything.com/author/scanlonbethanyk</ref>*<ref>http://www.amazon.com/Bethany-K.-Scanlon/e/B002BML43M/ref=ntt_athr_dp_pel_pop_1</ref> *<ref>http://www.filedby.com/author/bethany_k_scanlon/942996/</ref> *<ref>http://www.booktour.com/author/bethany_k_scanlon</ref> *<ref>www.planetteachpublications.com</ref> <references/>
[[Category:Writers from Texas]]

revision.text:
{{db-corp}} Computing systems rarely deliver best possible performance due to ever increasing hardware and software complexity and limitations of the current optimization technology. Additional code and architecture optimizations are often required to improve execution time, size, power consumption, reliability and other important characteristics of computing systems. Iterative compilation based on empirical feedback-directed optimization became a popular approach to optimize programs for different objective functions on architectures with ever growing complexity, when traditional compilers fails to deliver the best possible performance. However, lack of common research methodology and tools makes it difficult or even impossible to reproduce experiments and compare techniques from a large number of research publications on this topic.
The main aim of the community-driven [http://ctuning.org Collective Tuning Initiative] is to develop collaborative production-quality research tools with unified API (http://cTuning.org/cTools) and enable sharing profitable optimization cases from the community in the open optimization repository (http://cTuning.org/cdatabase). Using common R&D tools should help to improve the quality and reproducibility of the research of code and architecture design and optimization, and boost innovation in this area.
== Collaborative website ==
* http://ctuning.org
== cTuning optimization repository ==
* [[Collective_Optimization_Database|Collective Optimization Database]] is an open repository to share optimization cases from the community, provide web-services and plugins to analyze collective optimization data and predict good program optimizations based on statistical and machine learning techniques, and improve the quality and reproducibility of the compiler and architecture research.
== cTuning tools ==
* [http://ctuning.org/cpredict Online ML program optimization predictor (web-service)] is used to suggest profitable optimizations that improve execution time/code size/compilation time, etc based on similarities between programs (program features).
* [http://ctuning.org/ccc Continuous Collective Compilation Framework] is used to automate and distribute iterative feedback-directed exploration of large optimization spaces by multiple users.
* [[Interactive_Compilation_Interface|Interactive Compilation Interface]] "opens up" and transforms production compilers into stable interactive research toolsets using event-driven plugin system to avoid costly developments of new research compilers from scratch.
* [http://ctuning.org/cbench Collective Benchmark] with multiple datasets is used to enable realistic benchmarking and research on iterative compilation and run-time adaptation.
* [http://ctuning.org/unidapt Universal Adaptation Framework] is used to enable run-time adaptation and optimization of statically-compiled programs for heterogeneous multi-core architectures.
== Mailing Lists ==
* [http://groups.google.com/group/ctuning-discussions cTuning developments] * [http://groups.google.com/group/ctuning-announce cTuning announcements]
== References ==
* Grigori Fursin and Olivier Temam. ''Collective optimization''. Proceedings of the International Conference on High Performance Embedded Architectures & Compilers (HiPEAC 2009), Paphos, Cyprus, January 2009 ([http://fursin.net/wiki/index.php5?title=Research:Dissemination#FT2009 link])
* Grigori Fursin. Collective Tuning Initiative: automating and accelerating development and optimization of computing systems. Proceedings of the GCC Summit'09, Montreal, Canada, June 2009 ([http://unidapt.org/index.php/Dissemination#Fur2009 link])
== Press ==
* ''Rethinking code optimization for mobile and multicore'', InfoWorld, July 2009 ([http://www.infoworld.com/d/developer-world/rethinking-code-optimization-mobile-and-multicore-505 link]) * ''IBM Releases Open Source Machine Learning Compiler'', Slashdot, July 2009 ([http://tech.slashdot.org/story/09/07/03/0143233/IBM-Releases-Open-Source-Machine-Learning-Compiler link]) * ''World's First Intelligent, Open Source Compiler Provides Automated Advice on Software Code Optimization'', IBM press-release, June, 2009 ([http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/27874.wss link])

[[Fantastic Films]] | released = [[2010]] | runtime = | country = [[Ireland]] | language = [[English language|English]] | budget = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Wake Wood''''' ([[2009 in film|2009]]) is a upcoming [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Psychological thriller]] film, directed by David Keating and starring [[Timothy Spall]], [[Eva Birthistle]], [[Dan Gordon (actor)|Dan Gordon]] and [[Aidan Gillen]]. [http://www.exclusivemedia.com/productions/wakewood.php - Wake Wood]. == Plot == When a young Irish couple loses their 9-year-old daughter Alice to a terrifying attack, they discover a way to bring her back to life[http://www.exclusivemedia.com/productions/wakewood.php Exclusive Media - Wake Wood]. == Characters == * [[Timothy Spall]] - Arthur * [[Aidan Gillen]] - Patrick * [[Eva Birthistle]] - Louise * Ruth McCabe - Peggy O'Shea * Briain Gleeson - Martin O'Shea * Amelia Crowley - Mary Brogan * [[Dan Gordon (actor)|Dan Gordon]] - Mick O'Shea * Ella Connolly - Alice == Trivia == * The first feature from genre production company Hammer Films in thirty years[http://hammerandbeyond.blogspot.com/2009/06/is-wake-wood-doomed.html Is the Wake Wood doomed?]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{imdb title|1296899|title=Wake Wood}} [[Category:2009 films]] [[Category:British horror films]] [[Category:2000s horror films]] [[Category:Psychological thriller films]] [[Category:Upcoming films]] [[Category:Films set in Ireland]] [[Category:Drama films]]

revision.text:
== Summary == Fernando Paz Castillo (1893-1981), Venezuelan poet, diplomat and literary critic.
*Source: [http://www.antoniomiranda.com.br/Iberoamerica/venezuela/fernando_paz_castillo.html]

{{future television|type=series}} {{Infobox Television | show_name = Charity Lords of the Ring | image = | caption = | show_name_2 = | genre = [[Reality television|Reality competition]], [[Boxing]] | format = | creator = Screentime ShinAwil | developer = | writer = | director = | creative_director = | presenter = [[Lucy Kennedy]]
[[Barry McGuigan]] | starring = | judges = | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = {{IRL}} | language = [[English language|English]] | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 4 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = | producer = | editor = | location = | cinematography = | camera = | runtime = | company = | distributor = | channel = [[RTÉ One]] | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = | first_aired = 15 August 2009 | last_aired = 22 August 2009 | status = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = http://www.rte.ie/tv/lordsofthering/ | production_website = }} '''''Charity Lords of the Ring''''' is an upcoming reality competition, to be broadcast on [[RTÉ One]]. Presented by [[Lucy Kennedy]] and ex-boxer [[Barry McGuigan]], the four part series will follow ten personalities compete for their [[Charitable organization|charity]] of choice, in the field of [[boxing]]. The contestants were revealed during an episode of ''[[Saturday Night with Miriam]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.prosperity.ie/news/rte_launches_charity_lord_of_the_ring.html|title=RTE launches Charity Lord of the Ring.|date=27 July 2009|publisher=Prosperity|accessdate=2009-08-11}} == Format == The programme will feature 10 celebrities' experience through [[boot camp]], with assistance from [[Tim Withersoon]], [[Peter Taylor]] and [[Katie Taylor]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rte.ie/tv/lordsofthering/|title=RTÉ Television: Charity Lords of the Ring|publisher=RTÉ|language=English|accessdate=2009-08-11}} Only 10 per cent of each episode will be devoted to actual boxing.{{cite news|url=http://www.tribune.ie/news/home-news/article/2009/jul/26/rtes-lords-of-the-ring-thinks-outside-the-boxing/|title=RTE's 'Lords of the Ring' thinks outside the boxing|date=26 July 2009|publisher=Sunday Tribune|accessdate=2009-08-11}} All ten contributors had to take a half day medical before being allowed compete on the show.{{cite news|url=http://www.iftn.ie/?act1=record&only=1&aid=73&rid=4282368&tpl=archnewshome&force=1|title=‘Lords of the Ring’ to be Produced by Screentime ShinAwil for RTÉ |date=27 July 2009|publisher=IFTN|accessdate=2009-08-11}}{{cite web|url=http://www.rte.ie/about/pressreleases/2009/0726/charitylordofring260709.html|title=RTÉ Press Centre: Charity Lords of the Ring|date=26 July 2009|publisher=RTE|accessdate=2009-08-11}} In the first programme, four contestants will be selected to take part in first round of contests. Two of the competitors will be eliminated. The second programme will be of similar format, but another four will have to leave. Over €100,000 will be divided among the ten selected charities. == Contestants == On July 25, 2009 the competitors were announced for the programme. {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" | '''Contestants''' || '''Episode Eliminated''' |- | [[MacLean Burke]] || |- | [[Ben Clarke]] || |- | [[Sean Gallagher (businessman)|Sean Gallagher]] || |- | [[Paul Martin]] || |- | [[John McGuire]] || |- | [[Joe O'Shea]] || |- | [[Rob Ross]] || |- | [[Lee Sharpe]] || |- | [[Jack Sheedy]] || |- | [[Alan Shortt]] || |- |} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.rte.ie/tv/lordsofthering/ Official Site] at [[RTÉ.ie]] {{RTEp}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Charity Lords of the Ring}} [[Category:Irish reality television series]] [[Category:2009 television series debuts]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox GAA dualplayer | |image= |name =Geoffrey McGonagle |irish = |placeofbirth=[[Dungiven GAC|Dungiven]], [[County Londonderry]] |countryofbirth=
[[Northern Ireland]] |bday=26 |bmonth=9 |byear=1974 |dday= |dmonth= |dyear= |nickname=Big Geoffrey |feet=5 |inches=11 |occupation= |county=Derry |province=Ulster |clpositionf=Forward |clpositionh=Forward |club=[[Dungiven GAC|Dungiven]] (F)
[[Kevin Lynch's Hurling Club|Kevin Lynch's]] (H) |clyears=19xx-
19xx- |clapps(points)= |clubs=[[Dungiven GAC|Dungiven]] (F)
[[Kevin Lynch's Hurling Club|Kevin Lynch's]] (H) |clcountyf=2 |clcountyh=? |clprovincef=1 |clprovinceh=- |clallirelandf= |clallirelandh= |iccounty=Derry |counties=[[Derry GAA|Derry]] (F)
[[Derry GAA|Derry]] (H) |icpositionf=Forward |icpositionh=Forward |icyears=1994-200x
19xx-200x |icapps(points)= |icprovincef=1 |icprovinceh=2? |icallirelandf= |icallirelandh= |nfl=2/3? |nhl=- |allstarsf= |allstarsh= |icupdate= |clupdate= |}} '''Geoffrey McGonagle''' ({{lang-ga|'''-'''}}; born 26 September 1974) is an [[Ireland|Irish]] [[dual player|dual GAA player]] who played [[Gaelic football]] and [[hurling]] for [[Derry GAA|Derry]] in the 1990s and 2000s. McGonagle plays club football for [[Dungiven GAC|St. Canice's Dungiven]] and club hurling for [[Kevin Lynch's Hurling Club|Kevin Lynch's]]. He has had a highly successful career with both clubs. ==Personal life== McGonagle is from [[Dungiven]]. He went to primary school at St. Canice's in Dungiven{{cite journal |year=1995 |month=June |title=Interview with Hogan Stand magazine - Geoffrey McGonagle |journal=[[Hogan Stand]] |volume=5 |issue= |url=http://www.hoganstand.com/Derry/ArticleForm.aspx?ID=43863 |accessdate=11 August 2009 }} and secondary school at [[St. Patrick's Co-Ed Comprehensive College|St. Pat's College]] in [[Maghera]]. ==Football career== ===Club=== McGonagle won the [[Ulster Minor Club Football Championship]] with Dungiven in 1990. He started playing for Dungiven [[List of Gaelic Games terminology#S|Seniors]] while aged just 15. He was part of the Dungiven side that won the 1991 [[Derry Senior Football Championship]] - beating [[Newbridge GAC|Newbridge]] in the final. Dungiven reached the final again in 1996, but were defeated by [[Bellaghy GAC|Bellaghy]].{{cite news |first=Eamon |last=O'Hara |title=Cassidy double dumps Dungiven |work=[[The Irish News]] |date=1996 |accessdate=11 August 2009 |url=http://www.derrygaa.ie/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=397&Itemid=70 }} McGonagle won another Derry Championship medal in 1997, this time Dungiven beat [[Castledawson GAC|Castledawson]] in the final. They also went on to win the [[Ulster Senior Club Football Championship]] that year, with victory over [[Errigal Ciarán GAC|Errigal Ciarán]] in the decider. In 2008 in the twilight of his career McGonagle played as a goalkeeper for Dungiven. ===Inter-county=== McGonagle was part of the Derry [[List of Gaelic Games terminology#M|Minor]] team from a young age and won the 1990 [[Ulster Minor Football Championship]] with the county - beating [[Down GAA|Down]] in the final. He made his Senior debut in 1994 against [[Down GAA|Down]] in the [[National Football League (Ireland)|National League]]. In 1995 he won the National League with Derry, and another the following year.{{fact}} McGonagle helped Derry win the 1998 [[Ulster Senior Football Championship]]. In the final against Donegal, he set up fellow-Dungiven man [[Joe Brolly]] for the decisive goal late in the game. Derry beat [[Meath GAA|Meath]] in the 2000 National League final, giving McGonagle another League medal.{{cite web |title=Derry Football Roll of Honour |url=http://www.derrygaa.ie/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=73&Itemid=122 |date= |work=Official Derry GAA website |accessdate=11 August 2009}} ===School=== McGonagle had a successful school career winning seven Ulster Collees titles in football and hurling, inlcluding the [[Hogan Cup]] in 1990. ==Hurling career== {{Expand section}} ===Club=== McGonagle has won the [[Derry Senior Hurling Championship]] with Kevin Lynch's on ? occasions. The club also reached the [[Ulster Senior Club Hurling Championship]] final in 2003, 2006 and 2007, but were beaten each time. ===Inter-county=== McGonagle won one/two? [[Ulster Minor Hurling Championship]]s with the Derry Minor team. He also won one/two? [[Ulster Senior Hurling Championship]]s with the county in 2000?? and 2001. ===School=== ==Management career== {{Expand section}} ==Honours== ===Club=== ===Inter-county=== ===School=== ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.hoganstand.com/Derry/ArticleForm.aspx?ID=43863 Interview with Hogan Stand magazine] *[http://dungiven.derry.gaa.ie St. Canice's Dungiven website] *[http://www.kevinlynchs.com/ Kevin Lynch's website] *[http://derry.gaa.ie/ Official Derry GAA website] {{Navboxes |title= Geoffrey McGonagle navigation boxes |list1= {{Derry National Football League winners 1995}} {{Derry NFL Team 2000}} }} {{gaelic-football-bio-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:McGonagle, Geoffrey}} [[Category:Derry Gaelic footballers]] [[Category:Dungiven Gaelic footballers]] [[Category:Derry hurlers]] [[Category:Kevin Lynch's hurlers]] [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from County Dungiven]] [[Category:People from County Londonderry]]

{{db-person}} '''Ilija Grahovac''' called '''“Zmaj”''' (serbocroatian for Dragon) is a multiple awarded Cattle-breeder from a small Village near the town of Sipovo in the Republika Srbska in Bosnia and Herzegovina. He became an internet celebrity after the appearance of a viral video showing him at his Fathers Funeral were he held a three-hour-long unrelated, strange and embarrassing speech and attacked people verbally who have shown anger about the length of the speech. Soon these parts of the video found their way to the internet and made Ilija famous, this caught the attention of some TV-Stations which interviewed him, these interviews too were strange and also found their way to youtube and other portals. This all led to a “sequel”, Ilija recorded a new tape which was called “Dioba” in this film it is shown how Ilija and his Brother divide Cattle they have inherited from their father. Also some of Ilijas Family and Neighbors are shown at his home, in this movie too there are shown Speeches which Ilija held while drinking Beer out of his winner-Cups, and it seems that he was under the influence of alcohol. Weeks later there were seen unauthorized copys of the Funeral and Dioba in Bosnian Videoshops, wrapped in fan-made Covers. There are rumors about a third Film with Ilija Grahovac which is said to be a porn-movie, but till today such a movie hasn’t emerged from the net and the rumors about its existence may be triggered trough another Video in which Ilija talks about his potency and strength in bed.

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'This article details the bogie coaches that operate on the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] on the [[Isle of Man]]. Forming the frontline service fleet for day-to-day oper...'
revision.text:
This article details the bogie coaches that operate on the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] on the [[Isle of Man]]. Forming the frontline service fleet for day-to-day operation these coaches were built in-house by the line's carpenters, on the frames of two coaches purchased from [[Doddington, Cheshire|Doddington Park]] in [[Chipping Sodbury]] when restoration began. The original bodywork was deemed unsafe and not suitable for repair, although the coachwork was loosly based on this.
==No. 1== The first coach to arrive in the glen in 1985 this coach was originally roofless. It did not have brakegear initially, this being added in the third season of operation. To overcome this, all trains ran with a four-wheeled "bomb" wagon at either end to provide braking. By 1988 it had been fitted with an overall roof and valences to match the second coach, it remains in service today largely unaltered.
==No. 2== Following the same pattern as No. 1 but having a roof fitted when built, this coach was delivered in time for the return of steam locomotive "Sea Lion" in 1987 and is largely identical to the first coach, save for having the braking equipment and associated guards' accomodation at the alternative end, meaning the coaches always run in the same formation with a guards' compartment at each extremity of the train. Unaltered since arrival it remains in regular service today.
==No. 3== The third coach which was completed and delivered in 1994 is only used at peak times and always rides between the other two coaches. It is slightly different from the original two, owing to the proposed all-weather appearance which has not been executed.
==Livery== All the coaches are painted in a maroon livery, the original two carrying G.G.R. lettering until repaint in 2001 when this was lost; however in 2007 all three coaches were fitted with the new railway crest; interiors are black painted bench seating with black (changed from grey in early 2008) floors, featuing a hand-brake at one end of the vehicle.
==Miscellaneous== The coaches all feature a valance along their lengths using the same pattern as the original 1905 type coaches to give them a more authentic appearance. The coaches are numbered one to three but their fleet numbers are not immediately apparent as they are only painted on one end on the underframe.
==Bibliography== * {{cite book|author=Tony Beard|title=Groudle Glen Railway: Its History & Restoration|publisher=Groudle Glen Railway|year=1999|isbn=1-234280-04-X}} * {{cite book|author=David Smith|title= The Groudle Glen Railway |publisher=Plateway Press|location|year=1989|isbn=1-871980-00-X}} * {{cite book|author=I.o.M.S.R.S.A.|title=Manx Steam Railway News|publisher=I.o.M.S.R.S.A.|year=1966-2009|isbn=1-234280-04-X}}
==See also== *[[Isle of Man Steam Railway Supporters' Association]] *[[Groudle Glen Railway]] *[[British narrow gauge railways]]
==References== * {{cite book|author=Tony Beard|title=Groudle Glen Railway: Its History & Restoration|publisher=Groudle Glen Railway|year=1994}} * {{cite book|author=David Hyland Smith|title= The Groudle Glen Railway|publisher=Plateway Press|location=Brighton|year=1989|isbn=1-871980-00-X}} * ''Manx Steam Railway News'' Journal of the [[Isle of Man Steam Railway Supporters' Association]]
[[Category:Groudle Glen Railway]]

revision.text:
{{notenglish|Mandarin}} 钟骏源，享有新加坡第一企管教练之称，他自1996年起，就积极推广NLP商用心理学。
钟老师目前是新加坡中华总商会企业管理学院讲师和企业管理顾问。曾经培训许多新加坡与国外知名的企业主管。 他曾任记者、创意总监和行销副总裁。
钟老师是少数拥有新加坡新加坡标新局、新加坡专业咨询顾问、劳发局认证GEMS与ACTA培训和评估专业资格的中文讲师。他也拥有企业咨询、创意发展、企业重组、品质圈、人力发展、大众传媒和销售等专业资格。 他目前也是新加坡销售和服务业管理学会会长。
钟老师自95年起就在中华总商会企业管理学院主讲的课程包括：品牌经营和管理，零售管理，行销管理，销售管理，商用心理学与领导学等课程。拥有近20年的讲课经验的他常以风趣、深入浅出的方式与同学分享专业知识，是新加坡中华总商会企业管理学院最受学生爱戴的讲师。
钟老师是新加坡首个考核美国NLP大学认证身心语言学培训导师，澳洲性格心理学、 人力发展、职业辅导等资格的华语导师。他自96年起就积极推广企业实用心理学。 自2004年起，他也受邀为新加坡羽球队员提供心理培训课程和咨询。
多年来他除了在新加坡多个本地知名学院讲课外，也曾为来自中国北京、南昌、福建 、山东、 烟台、郑州、苏州、河北、云南、江阴、无锡、宁波、天津、深圳、南通、广洲和上海等地的高层政、经、教考察团讲课。
他也曾到马来西亚、印尼、泰国、台湾和中国等地主讲企业诊断师、行销、管理心理学、传播学、品牌管理培训和MBA等课程。
他曾参与咨询顾问的组织包括：新加坡警察部队、卫生部、内政部、英国文化协会、无比石油、丽星邮轮、MrBEAN、科艺、泰村鱼翅、大金冷气、Subaru 、 SEAT轿车、万豪、国立大学 、Kodak、KENWOOD、创美室、南洋理工学院、安盛保险 、 方圆集体、白兰氏 、 Autotype 、 Eng Leong Medallic 、 马光医药集团、大东方保险、阿酋航空、Nikon、Aasperon、Minolta、Marina Square、Plaza Singapura、罗敏生酒店、Mariott酒店、New Trend Lifestyle、Royal Sporting House，中国银行、中国招商银行、上海浦东银行、中国邮政、上海机场、新加坡民航学院、新加坡警察部队、Johnhancock保险、成春农场、E-Bay、iWOW、ORACLE、Sportlinks、 Phoenix Hotel 、Cartier、BLUM、Meyson珠宝和Taime等多个知名客户提供培训与行销企划，拥有丰富的企业实战经验。
钟老师的著作共有四本《知人人心》、《雨伞》、《全脑人才》和《行销心战略》。钟老师也常受邀上媒体接受访问，与企业分享企管知识。

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with ''''Muljangori-oreum''' wetland is a mountain crater lake formed at the volcanic crater, which is at 900m~937m above the sea level, 9km of the northeast side of Mt....'
revision.text:
'''Muljangori-oreum''' wetland is a mountain crater lake formed at the volcanic crater, which is at 900m~937m above the sea level, 9km of the northeast side of Mt. Halla (1,950 m). The 628000m<small>2</small> lake provides water, which is not abundant on the island, to hawks, fairy pitas, black kites, Japanese lesser sparrow hawks, black paradise flycatchers and other rare animals
==Characteristics== Muljangori-oreum is a parasitic cone formed by volcanic activities at the end of the third Cenozoic Era and exists only in Jeju island. Around Halla-san, about 370 parasitic cones are located and only about 30% of them has mountain craters. Oreum is mostly composed of water-permeable basalt, so it’s difficult to have a wet mountain crater lake on the top of Oreum.
The lake(Muljangori-oreum) 900m above the sea level maintains its surface water by the rainfall. During the dry season, most part of wetland becomes dry except the deepest hole in the south (about 50 m of water depth) and during the rainy season, most of it gets submerged under the water.
==Organisms== '''Birds''' * [[Peregrine falcon]] (''Falco peregrinus'') * [[Fairy pitta]] (''Pitta brachyura nympha'') * [[black kite]] (''Milvus migrans'') * [[Japanese sparrowhawk]] (''Accipiter gularis'') * [[Japanese paradise-flycatcher]] (''Terpsiphone atrocaudata'') * [[obovata peony]] (''Paeonia obovata''). * [[Black paradise flycatcher]] (''Terpsiphone atrocaudata'') * [[Fabriciana nerippe]] (F:Papilionoidea) * [[Lethocerus deyrollei]] (F: Belostomatidae).
'''Plants''' * Japanese strawberry tree (''Cornus kousa'' ), * Painted Maple (''Acer pictum subsp. monoi'' ), * Juncus effusus * Scripus triangulates, * Persicaria hydropiper.
69 families, 136 genera, 181 species of flowering plants inhabits here
